title: Strengthening of the milk's productive chain, to increase peasant family income in San Silvestre de Cochíçn, Peru
short_description: STRENGTHENING OF THE MILK'S PRODUCTIVE CHAIN, TO INCREASE PEASANT FAMILY INCOME IN SAN SILVESTRE DE COCHíÅN, PERU
long_description: El proyecto contribuiríç a la mejora de las condiciones de vida de los campesinos ganaderos en el Distrito de San Silvestre de Cochíçn, Cajamarca, Perí_, mediante el fortalecimiento de la cadena productiva de la leche,, en 22 Comunidades (18 Caserí_os y 4 Centros poblados Con 4.642 habitantes) El objetivo especí_fico es mejorar la productividad y los niveles de ingresos de los pequeí±os ganaderos campesinos mediante el fortalecimiento de la cadena productiva de la leche, en sinergia con los agentes de desarrollo del Distrito. El proyecto de 24 meses de duracií_n tiene 4 componentes:En el primer componente se formaríç a un equipo de 30 promotores pecuarios y mujeres lí_deres tecní_logas para brindar servicios de extensií_n pecuaria (de campesino a campesino) a los campesinos ganaderos de la regií_n. Los promotores asociados, con el apoyo de proyecto, crearíçn y gestionaríçn un centro de servicios de extensií_n pecuaria que les permitiríç llegar a 15 comunidades de manera permanente prestando servicios de asistencia tí©cnica en el manejo de la ganaderí_a (veterinaria, inseminacií_n) En el segundo componente el equipo local, junto con los promotores y lí_deres de tecnologí_a, asistiríç a 270 ganaderos y 30 jí_venes en el aprendizaje e implementacií_n de tí©cnicas y príçcticas de alimentacií_n, reproduccií_n, manejo ganadero e innovacií_n tecnolí_gica. La instalacií_n de pastos cultivados, semilleros, establos, la ejecucií_n de programas de inseminacií_n artificial e, investigaciones participativas son algunas de las actividades que se desarrollan en este componente. El tercer componente del proyecto mejoraríç la disponibilidad de agua para uso productivo de 80 familias campesinas mediante la construccií_n de un sistema de riego tecnificado. Las familias beneficiarias recibiríçn ademíçs capacitacií_n para el uso racional del agua y el mantenimiento del sistema. El cuarto y í_ltimo componente del proyecto estíç orientado al fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales y a la promocií_n de espacios de concertacií_n entre entidades de gobierno, empresas y poblacií_n campesina, para el fomento de la cadena productiva de la leche.El conjunto de actividades de formacií_n, implantacií_n de tecnologí_as, aumentaríç la productividad lechera de 300 pequeí±os ganaderos campesinos, del Distrito de San Silvestre de Cochíçn en un 30% . El incremento de la productividad, permitiríç a su vez disminuir la pobreza de las familias beneficiarias, en tanto que permitiríç un incremente del 25% de los ingresos familiares por la venta de leche, terneras y servicios agropecuarios.

long_description: The goal of the SOCODEVI project is to allow thousand of women and men to improve their livelihoods and their capacities for takeover through sustainable economic growth. The project aims to strengthen cooperatives, mutuals, and other associations in order to improve their economic, organizational, and governance performance. The project aims to help cooperatives and mutuals generate more economic activity through more effective organizations, thereby achieving greater profitability and providing better services to their members and to the general public. The project also aims to help cooperatives and mutuals become more influential within civil society and with government, to have a more significant impact on their community. / Le but du projet de SOCODEVI est de permettre íæ des milliers de femmes et d'hommes d'amí©liorer leurs conditions de vie et leurs capacití©s de prise en charge et ce, íæ travers une croissance í©conomique durable. Le projet vise íæ aider les mouvements coopí©ratifs et mutualistes íæ gí©ní©rer des activití©s í©conomiques plus importantes íæ travers des organisations plus performantes, atteignant ainsi une meilleure rentabilití© et donnant de meilleurs services íæ leurs membres et íæ la population en gí©ní©ral. Le projet vise aussi íæ aider les les mouvements coopí©ratifs et mutualistes íæ exercer une influence accrue au sein de la socií©tí© civile et aupríÂs des gouvernements pour gí©ní©rer un impact plus significatif dans leur communautí©.

title: Fighting children undernourishment in the Sierra Central, Perí_.
short_description: FIGHTING CHILDREN UNDERNOURISHMENT IN THE SIERRA CENTRAL, PERí_.
long_description: El presente proyecto es una continuacií_n de la iniciativa Combatir la Desnutricií_n Infantil en la Sierra Central del Perí_ presentada por Accií_n Contra el Hambre al Gobierno de Navarra en las convocatorias del 2009 y 2010. El proyecto centra sus esfuerzos en reducir el abrumador % de nií±os y nií±as menores de 3 aí±os que padecen anemia en el Perí_, 50,3% , siendo del 67% en la provincia de Vilcashuamíçn, departamento de Ayacucho. La anemia, como la desnutricií_n crí_nica, hipoteca el futuro de la infancia al impedir su desarrollo integral, provoca inasistencia y fracaso escolar, ademíçs de suponer un costo de oportunidad muy alto para el paí_s, 5% del PIB .Accií_n Contra el Hambre propone combatir la anemia en menores de 3 aí±os de la provincia de Vilcas Huamíçn ayudando a visualizar el problema y fortaleciendo el actual programa estatal de suplementacií_n de nutrientes. Este trabajo que se llevaríç a cabo en alianza con UNICEF, estaríç centrado en desarrollar una estrategia de comunicacií_n integral en anemia (ECA), involucrando a familias, especialmente mujeres y jí_venes (de 4 distritos), centros de salud y autoridades provinciales, y estaríç adecuada culturalmente al contexto quechua andino, aplicando metodologí_as de trabajo ya avaladas por el Gobierno de Navarra y desarrolladas en el paí_s por Mí©dicos Mundi Navarra.

title: CONSOLIDATION OF AREAS OF AGREEMENT CONCERNING PUBLIC POLICY ON DISABILITY IN PERU
short_description: CONSOLIDATION OF AREAS OF AGREEMENT CONCERNING PUBLIC POLICY ON DISABILITY IN PERU
long_description: EL PROYECTO NACE DESDE LA NECESIDAD DE IMPULSAR LA CONCERTACIíñN ENTRE EL ESTADO Y LAS PERSONAS CON DISCAPACIDAD EN EL ACTUAL PROCESO DE DESCENTRALIZACIíñN Y DESARROLLO DE PERí_. ASUME COMO OBJETIVO GENERAL CONTRIBUIR A MEJORAR LA INTEGRACIíñN SOCIAL Y POLíçTICA DE LAS PERSONAS CON DISCAPACIDAD EN EL PAíçS, TENIENDO COMO OBJETIVO ESPECíçFICO EL DE INCREMENTAR LA INCIDENCIA DE LOS ESPACIOS LOCALES DE CONCERTACIíñN ENTRE LA SOCIEDAD CIVIL Y EL ESTADO, SOBRE LAS POLíçTICAS Pí_BLICAS RELACIONADAS A LA DISCAPACIDAD. LA INTERVENCIíñN SE DIRIGE DIRECTAMENTE A 250 LíçDERES CON DISCAPACIDAD Y 120 AUTORIDADES (ANEXO 2.7) DE LAS OFICINAS MUNICIPALES DE ATENCIíñN A LA PERSONA CON DISCAPACIDAD (OMAPEDS),OFICINA REGIONAL DE LA PERSONA CON DISCAPACIDAD (OREDIS) Y CONSEJO NACIONAL PARA LA INTEGRACIíñN DE LA PERSONA CON DISCAPACIDAD-CONADIS, QUIENES A PARTIR DEL DESARROLLO DE LAS ACTIVIDADES DEL PROYECTO, TENDRíÅN EL COMPROMISO DE IMPULSAR Y PARTICIPAR ACTIVAMENTE EN LOS ESPACIOS DE CONCERTACIíñN DE POLíçTICAS Pí_BLICAS EN TORNO A LA DISCAPACIDAD, Y DE CONSOLIDAR LOS COMPROMISOS ASUMIDOS EN LAS LOCALIDADES DONDE YA EXISTEN, COMO íÅMBITOS DE CONCERTACIíñN, LAS MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD (ANEXO 2.6; 2.8).PARA CONSEGUIR EL OBJETIVO PREVISTO, SE CONTEMPLAN DOS RESULTADOS:R 1: FORTALECIDA LA CAPACIDAD DE LAS ORGANIZACIONES DE PERSONAS CON DISCAPACIDAD PARA EJERCER VIGILANCIA CIUDADANA Y GESTIONAR LAS MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD. LAS ACTIVIDADES PREVISTAS SON:-IMPLEMENTACIíñN DE UN EQUIPO EJECUTOR -5 CONVENIOS DE COLABORACIíñN CON ENTIDADES RELACIONADAS A LA DISCAPACIDAD-2 TALLERES NACIONALES SOBRE INCIDENCIA POLíçTICA, GOBERNABILIDAD Y CONTEXTO GLOBAL, DIRIGIDOS A 200 LíçDERES CON DISCAPACIDAD-3 TALLERES MACRO-REGIONALES DE VIGILANCIA CIUDADANA, DIRIGIDOS A 250 LíçDERES CON DISCAPACIDAD-3 TALLERES MACRO-REGIONALES SOBRE GESTIíñN Pí_BLICA LOCAL Y REGIONAL, DIRIGIDOS A 125 LíçDERES CON DISCAPACIDAD-25 FOROS LOCALES SOBRE NORMAS INTERNACIONALES RATIFICADAS POR PERí_ EN MATERIA DE DISCAPACIDAD-2 FOROS NACIONALES-4 MANUALES SOBRE VIGILANCIA CIUDADANA; MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD; NORMAS INTERNACIONALES VINCULANTES SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD; GOBIERNOS LOCALES, REGIONALES Y LAS PERSONAS CON DISCAPACIDAD-ELABORACIíñN DE 20 BOLETINES MENSUALESR 2: FORTALECIDA LA PARTICIPACIíñN DE LAS OMAPEDS, OREDIS Y CONADIS EN LAS MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDADLAS ACTIVIDADES PREVISTAS SON:-30 REUNIONES DE COORDINACIíñN CON AUTORIDADES Pí_BLICAS-3 TALLERES SOBRE MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN Y PROYECTOS DE INVERSIíñN Pí_BLICA, DIRIGIDOS A 120 AUTORIDADES DE LAS OMAPEDS, OREDIS Y CONADIS-CREACIíñN DE 15 NUEVAS MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD(ANEXO2.8)-ASESORAMIENTO Tí_CNICO-LEGAL A LAS 30 MESAS DE PARTICIPACIíñN SOBRE DISCAPACIDAD

long_description: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men. The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise íæ contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rí©gionales íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et au dí©veloppement durable dans 13 pays en dí©veloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. short_description: ESTABLISHMENT OF MOBILE HEALTH CLINICS / MISE EN PLACE DE CLINIQUES MOBILES DE SANTí_
long_description: This project provides greater access to primary health care, including basic dental and gynecological services, to poor indigenous women and their families living in remote, mountainous areas of south-eastern Peru. Using three mobile clinics, professionals from private and public health institutions will tour villages to deliver quality health services to beneficiaries at substantially lower costs than market price. The project is in line with the Peruvian government's strategy to facilitate access to health care for poor and vulnerable populations and is complementary to Peru's national health insurance system. The project is implemented by Impact First International (formerly GEMS of Hope), in collaboration with Pro Mujer Peru. This is one of two parts of a project valued at $319,723. The first part has been completed. / Ce projet donne un meilleur accíÂs aux soins de santí© primaires, incluant des soins dentaires de base et des services gyní©cologiques, aux femmes autochtones pauvres et íæ leurs familles vivant dans des rí©gions reculí©es et montagneuses au sud-est du Pí©rou. Des professionnels d'institutions de santí© publiques et priví©es parcourent les villages avec trois cliniques mobiles et offrent des soins de santí© aux bí©ní©ficiaires íæ des coíéts beaucoup plus bas que ceux du marchí©. Le projet est en lien avec la stratí©gie du gouvernement pí©ruvien visant íæ faciliter l'accíÂs aux soins de santí© aux plus pauvres et vulní©rables de la socií©tí©. Il est complí©mentaire au systíÂme national d'assurance pour la santí©. Ce projet est mis en oeuvre par Impact First International (anciennement GEMS of Hope), en collaboration avec Pro Mujer Peru. Il s'agit d'une des deux parties d'un projet d'une valeur totale de 319 723 $. La premiíÂre partie est terminí©e.

title: Voluntary Cooperation Programme / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire
short_description: VOLUNTARY COOPERATION PROGRAMME / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE
long_description: SUCO's three-month VCP program proposal aims to consolidate the achievements of the five-year program that ended on March 31, 2009. Activities in this regard will focus on consolidating the new knowledge and practices that partners have acquired, as well as developing tools to evaluate, systematize, and capitalize on experience. SUCO will mainly focus its efforts on three CIDA priorities: promoting good governance, supporting private-sector development, and promoting environmental sustainability, with a view to partner capacity-building. SUCO will also help Canadians to learn more about, and become more involved in, development and solidarity among peoples. All activities undertaken in countries of intervention will help to reduce poverty and to promote equality between women and men. / La proposition de trois (3) mois du PCV de SUCO est orientí© vers le renforcement des connaissances et des nouvelles pratiques acquises par les partenaires et le dí©veloppement d'outils d'í©valuation, de systí©matisation et de capitalisation des expí©riences. Les efforts de SUCO seront concentrí©s principalement dans trois secteurs prioritaires de l'ACDI: la promotion de la bonne gouvernance, le soutien au dí©veloppement du secteur priví© et la promotion de la viabilití© de l'environnement dans une optique de renforcement des capacití©s des partenaires. Ils contribueront í©galement íæ accroí¬tre l'í©ducation et l'engagement du public canadien en faveur du dí©veloppement et de la solidarití© entre les peuples. Toutes les actions entreprises dans les pays d'intervention contribueront íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et íæ la promotion de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes.

title: Prevention and Control of Communicable Diseases / Prí©vention et maí¬trise des maladies transmissibles
short_description: PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF COMMUNICABLE DISEASES / PRí_VENTION ET MAí_TRISE DES MALADIES TRANSMISSIBLES
long_description: The Prevention and Control of Priority Communicable Diseases (PCPCD) project is being implemented by the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) in collaboration with the Ministries of Health of Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, and Venezuela. This project contributes to the prevention and control of communicable diseases that cause the greatest burden of morbidity and mortality among children, youth, and adults in South America. In children, the diseases that frequently affect their health are diarrhoeal disease and acute respiratory infections. In youth and adults, these diseases are sexually transmitted infections (STIs), including HIV/AIDS, Chagas disease, and tuberculosis. The project also strengthens the capacity of institutions responsible for planning, managing, and delivering sustainable and comprehensive programs for the prevention and control of the most prevalent communicable diseases. The first stage of this project with PAHO has already been completed. The total value of the two stages together is $10 million. / Le projet de prí©vention et de maí¬trise des maladies transmissibles prioritaires est mis en oeuvre par l'Organisation panamí©ricaine de la santí© (OPS) en collaboration avec les ministíÂres de la Santí© de la Colombie, de l'í_quateur, du Paraguay, du Pí©rou et du Venezuela. Ce projet contribue íæ prí©venir et íæ maí¬triser les maladies transmissibles qui ont la plus grande incidence sur les taux de morbidití© et de mortalití© chez les enfants, les jeunes et les adultes en Amí©rique du Sud. Chez les enfants, les maladies les plus frí©quentes sont les maladies diarrhí©iques et les infections aiguí‚s des voies respiratoires. Chez les jeunes et les adultes, il s'agit des infections transmissibles sexuellement (ITS), dont le VIH/sida, la maladie de Chagas et la tuberculose. Ce projet renforce aussi la capacití© des institutions chargí©es de la planification, de la gestion et de l'exí©cution de programmes complets et durables en ce qui concerne la prí©vention et la maí¬trise des maladies transmissibles les plus courantes. La premiíÂre í©tape de ce projet avec l'OPS est dí©jíæ terminí©e. La valeur totale des deux í©tapes ensemble est 10 millions de dollars.

long_description: This project enables the participation of representatives from eligible countries at the conference ''Rethinking Extractive Industry: Regulation, Dispossession, and Emerging Claims'' in Toronto, Ontario, from March 5 to 7, 2009. The conference responds to growing public debate and academic interest in the increasing numbers of social, political, and environmental issues and conflicts that are being generated by the recent rapid growth of mining and petroleum industries in Canada, the Americas, and Africa. / Ce projet permet aux reprí©sentants des pays admissibles de participer íæ la confí©rence intitulí©e Œ‚ Rethinking Extractive Industry: Regulation, Dispossession, and Emerging Claims Œé, tenue íæ Toronto (Ontario), du 5 au 7 mars 2009. La confí©rence faire í©cho íæ la hausse des dí©bats publics et de l'intí©ríÈt des universitaires concernant la multiplication des enjeux et des conflits sociaux, politiques et environnementaux engendrí©s par la croissance rapide des industries miniíÂres et pí©troliíÂres au Canada, dans les Amí©riques et en Afrique.

title: CUSO-VSO Program Support April-June 2009 / CUSO-VSO Appui au programme avril-juin 2009
short_description: CUSO-VSO PROGRAM SUPPORT APRIL-JUNE 2009 / CUSO-VSO APPUI AU PROGRAMME AVRIL-JUIN 2009
long_description: CUSO-VSO Program Support April-June 2009 This six-month agreement is a continuation of support to CUSO-VSO that will enable it to make a transition from its current program (2004-2009), to a new 5-year program that is currently under consideration by Treasury Board for approval in Summer/Fall 2009. Under this transition agreement, CUSO-VSO will place 55 volunteers globally as part of existing and new partnerships in five thematic areas: Education, HIV/AIDS, Participation and Governance/Access to Justice for Women & Children, Youth Social and Economic Inclusion, Environmental Protection, with Gender Equality as a cross-cutting theme. Volunteers will be placed in 7 countries in Africa (Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Ghana, Nigeria, Rwanda, Tanzania), 7 countries in Latin America & Caribbean (Bolivia, El Salvador, Guatemala, Guyana, Honduras, Jamaica, Peru), and 1 in Asia (Indonesia). Volunteers can be North-South (Canadian citizens or landed immigrants placed in the South); South-South (Southerners volunteering in other Southern countries; National (Southerners volunteering in their own country); Diaspora (members of Diaspora groups in the North placed in their origin countries); South-North (Southern volunteers placed in Canada). The program's Public Engagement component will increase Canadian public understanding of international development issues and the value of volunteer cooperation; contribute to increased dialogue about international development and Canada's contribution; and engage various Canadian organizations in collaborations with Southern counterparts. / íó venir

title: Economic Sustainability, Gender Equality and Human Rights / Viabilití© í©conomique, í©galití© des sexes et droits de la personne
short_description: MULTISECTOR AID
long_description: The main purpose of the program is to work directly with Latin American partners to improve the lives of men and women by reducing poverty. CoDev's program focuses on gender equality and citizen participation for good governance through economic sustainability by improving labour rights; the quality of public education; and promoting basic human rights. The program also facilitates and promotes exchange of south-south, north-south and south-north experiences. Key activities of the program include: (1) 625 workshops in the region on education, basic rights and gender issues; (2) 45 community consultations on basic rights; (3) legal accompaniment for 6,000 workers; (4) three regional media campaigns to raise awareness of human and labour rights; (5) 15 rights policy proposals by partners to governments and employers; (6) 30 human rights training programs; and (7) 10 outreach activities in Canada. / L'objectif principal du programme est de collaborer directement avec les partenaires latino-amí©ricains pour travailler íæ l'amí©lioration de la qualití© de vie des hommes et des femmes en rí©duisant la pauvretí©. Le programme de CoDev se concentre sur l'í©galití© des sexes et la participation des citoyens pour une bonne gouvernance par la viabilití© í©conomique en amí©liorant les droits des travailleurs, la qualití© de l'í©ducation publique et en favorisant les droits fondamentaux de la personne. Le programme facilite et favorise í©galement l'í©change d'expí©riences Sud-Sud, Nord-Sud et Sud-Nord. Les activití©s principales du programme comprennent : 1) 625 ateliers dans la rí©gion sur l'í©ducation et les droits fondamentaux en matiíÂre d'í©galití© des sexes; 2) 45 consultations communautaires sur les droits fondamentaux; 3) l'accompagnement lí©gal de 6 000 travailleurs; 4) trois campagnes mí©diatiques rí©gionales pour sensibiliser la population sur les droits de la personne et les droits des travailleurs; 5) 15 propositions de politiques soumises par les partenaires aux gouvernements et aux employeurs; 6) 30 programmes de formation sur les droits de la personne; 7) 10 activití©s de sensibilisation au Canada.

title: Intensification of Smallholder Agriculture in the Andes (CIFSRF)
short_description: INTENSIFICATION OF SMALLHOLDER AGRICULTURE IN THE ANDES (CIFSRF)
long_description: Poverty in rural areas of Peru is almost three times higher than in urban areas, and in certain regions of the Andes, it affects up to 80% of the population. Organic agriculture provides an opportunity to increase overall farm performance, build resilient farming systems, reduce poverty and improve food security in a sustainable way. However, organic farming can do little to improve food security and livelihoods unless ecological, social and economic factors are taken into consideration.This project - supported by the Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF), a joint program of IDRC and the Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) - will enable researchers to examine intensive organic smallholder farming systems in two regions of the Peruvian Andes known for their biodiversity and active farmers' associations.Researchers will endeavor to increase farm productivity, by enhancing ecological cycles, improving seed through participatory plant breeding and valorizing indigenous crops. They will also look at social processes such as traditional knowledge, innovation, organizational links, policy and advocacy. Finally the project will include an economic component, dealing with livelihood dynamics, guarantee systems and access to markets for organic produce in the region.

long_description: The goal of the SOCODEVI project is to allow thousand of women and men to improve their livelihoods and their capacities for takeover through sustainable economic growth. The project aims to strengthen cooperatives, mutuals, and other associations in order to improve their economic, organizational, and governance performance. The project aims to help cooperatives and mutuals generate more economic activity through more effective organizations, thereby achieving greater profitability and providing better services to their members and to the general public. The project also aims to help cooperatives and mutuals become more influential within civil society and with government, to have a more significant impact on their community. / Le but du projet de SOCODEVI est de permettre íæ des milliers de femmes et d'hommes d'amí©liorer leurs conditions de vie et leurs capacití©s de prise en charge et ce, íæ travers une croissance í©conomique durable. Le projet vise íæ aider les mouvements coopí©ratifs et mutualistes íæ gí©ní©rer des activití©s í©conomiques plus importantes íæ travers des organisations plus performantes, atteignant ainsi une meilleure rentabilití© et donnant de meilleurs services íæ leurs membres et íæ la population en gí©ní©ral. Le projet vise aussi íæ aider les les mouvements coopí©ratifs et mutualistes íæ exercer une influence accrue au sein de la socií©tí© civile et aupríÂs des gouvernements pour gí©ní©rer un impact plus significatif dans leur communautí©.

title: Promoting Research for Policymaking  under Decentralization in Peru (CIES)
short_description: PROMOTING RESEARCH FOR POLICYMAKING UNDER DECENTRALIZATION IN PERU (CIES)
long_description: Major reforms in governance carried out in Peru during the early 2000s saw the decentralization of functions and resources from the central government in Lima to elected regional governments. Today, regional governments account for the majority of public investment, but show limited capacity to cope with the responsibility. Moreover, capacity for research and evidence based policymaking remains weak outside Lima. This grant will allow the Consortium for Economic and Social Research (CIES - Consorcio de Investigacií€Œ_n Econí€Œ_mica y Social) - a network of 44 thinktanks in 12 regions of Peru - to continue funding social and economic research with a focus on growth and equity, and to connect research to policy with renewed communications capacity. At the same time, the Consortium will step up its efforts to strengthen the research capacity of research centres in the regions, and endeavor to find additional sources of funding for its research competition.

title: Oxfam Quebec Voluntary Cooperation Program 2009 / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec
short_description: OXFAM QUEBEC VOLUNTARY COOPERATION PROGRAM 2009 / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE 2009 D'OXFAM-QUí_BEC
long_description: This three-month program will bridge the current program (VCP 2004-2009) and the ''Mieux agir, Mieux influencer'' [more effective action, greater impact] program (VCP 2009-2014). The program is designed to provide an ideal forum to implement activities in preparation for a larger program, and to consider new planning and performance measurement frameworks for the Volunteer Cooperation Program. Through the Volunteer Cooperation Program, Oxfam-Quí©bec aims to help communities in developing countries to initiate or consolidate processes of endogenous development to address major problems relating to poverty and injustice. On the one hand, the program will aim to achieve measurable and tangible results (changes) in the lives of people and organizations (Mieux agir). On the other hand, the program will enable NGOs to build their capacities for dialogue and cooperation with other stakeholders. This will involve making data available during the next program, so that NGOs can become more influential, based on accurate information about the needs of communities, and thus increase the potential impact of public policy (Mieux influencer). In this regard, priority will be given to carrying out studies to provide more effective support for the engagement of partners in specific sectors. During the period, Oxfam-Quí©bec will maintain and continue to strengthen its engagement in five areas of intervention, whose objectives for change focus on basic human rights. These areas are: Economic justice: women entrepreneurs, agricultural development (especially food security), and the private sector - Essential services: access to basic education, access to water and sanitation, improvement of health - Rights in crisis: rights of communities that are victims of humanitarian crises - Gender justice: violence against women and women's rights - Empowerment of youth (crosscutting theme) / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec Le programme de coopí©ration volontaire de trois (3) mois d'Oxfam-Quí©bec vise íæ renforcer son intervention dans cinq secteurs d'intervention dont les objectifs de changement s'articulent autour des droits fondamentaux de la personne. Ces secteurs sont: la justice í©conomique et plus particuliíÂrement l'entrepreneuriat fí©minin, le dí©veloppement agricole (la sí©curití© alimentaire et le secteur priví©); les services essentiels de base, tel que l'accíÂs íæ l'í©ducation de base, l'accíÂs íæ l'eau et íæ l'assainissement, l'amí©lioration de la santí©; les droits en situation de crise, tel que le droit des populations victimes de crise humanitaire; ainsi que l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes, plus particuliíÂrement la violence faite aux femmes et les droits des femmes

title: Support to: Building a Secure Mobile Financial Transactions System in Peru
short_description: SUPPORT TO: BUILDING A SECURE MOBILE FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS SYSTEM IN PERU
long_description: The Opportunities for the Majority Sector requests approval of an Operational Input related to the loan transaction PE-L1103: Building a Secure Mobile Financial Transactions System in Peru. The financial resources of the TC will be used to support GKN in its efforts to validate the key assumptions underlying its business model and technology approach for the deployment of a safe and reliable mobile branchless banking and payments platform serving PeruŒËs largely rural un-banked and under-served population. The key operational variables to be tested include the average number of transactions per enrolled customer per month, the average value of the transactions and the mix of transactions among GKNŒËs fourkey products/service offerings: financial transactions based on business to business (B2B) payment services, Electronic Wallets1, and mobile banking (m-banking) and point of sale (POS) purchases. Actual behavior along these dimensions will allow GKN to establish a solid statistical basis for forecastingrevenues.

title: The financing of culture: a shared responsibility among the public and private sector.
short_description: THE FINANCING OF CULTURE: A SHARED RESPONSIBILITY AMONG THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTOR.
long_description: Con motivo de la reciente aprobacií_n de la Ley de Mecenazgo Cultural en Perí_, el paí_s comienza una nueva trayectoria en materia de patrocinio y mecenazgo cultural. Desde la Fundacií_n de Casas Histí_ricas y Singulares se propone la realizacií_n de un Encuentro en Lima, de íçmbito iberoamericano, para reflexionar y compartir experiencias y conocimientos sobre la colaboracií_n efectiva entre los sectores pí_blico y privado en la defensa, difusií_n y gestií_n del Patrimonio Cultural, con las que hacer realidad el derecho de acceso a la cultura. El Encuentro reuniríç a profesionales de instituciones culturales pí_blicas y privadas, a entidades y personas interesadas en la materia y a jí_venes profesionales y estudiantes, ademíçs de a toda la ciudadaní_a comprometida con temas culturales. Se organizaríçn cuatro bloques temíçticos: 1- el marco jurí_dico del Patrimonio y del mecenazgo cultural. El apoyo econí_mico a la Cultura desde el sector pí_blico; 2- iniciativas desde el íçmbito privado: el patrocinio, el asociacionismo, el voluntariado cultural y otras colaboraciones pí_blico-privadas. Un bloque 3 se dedicaríç a la presentacií_n de experiencias concretas de gestií_n cultural, integradoras y sostenibles, que hayan contribuido eficazmente al desarrollo socio-econí_mico de las poblaciones afectadas. Un í_ltimo bloque se destinaríç a la presentacií_n de proyectos culturales que buscan financiacií_n. Se trata de un Encuentro de cuatro dí_as (uno por bloque), a realizar previsiblemente durante el mes de noviembre de 2012. El proyecto terminaríç con una muy rigurosa evaluacií_n de sus resultados en los seis meses posteriores al Encuentro. El intercambio entre profesionales iberoamericanos que ya cuentan con una trayectoria en polí_ticas de mecenazgo y los profesionales de la Cultura peruanos redundaríç en la promocií_n de actitudes responsables y comportamientos efectivos a la hora de aplicar y desarrollar la Ley y el mecenazgo. Este tipo de encuentros es tambií©n muy adecuado para acercar a profesionales, entidades y potenciales patrocinadores, pudiendo ser el origen de nuevas colaboraciones. Por í_ltimo, un evento de este tipo constituye un momento privilegiado para profesionales, estudiantes y ciudadaní_a interesada en temas culturales para acercarse al proceso interno de distintas iniciativas y a los nichos de empleo y de actividad que pueden surgir asociados a la Cultura y al Patrimonio. El Encuentro cuenta con un claro enfoque EDB en el sentido de que el Foro se presenta como un momento de debate sobre la polí_tica pí_blica (Ley de Mecenazgo), ademíçs de poner a disposicií_n de la ciudadaní_a una serie de conocimientos, herramientas de trabajo y de reflexií_n para que el tejido cultural peruano pueda fortalecer y mejorar las iniciativas de financiacií_n y soporte publico-privado de la Cultura.

long_description: The goal of the project is to improve economic and social development in the district of Quiruvilca in the La Libertad region of Peru for local households, with a particular emphasis on women and youth. World Vision Canada works with local authorities to set up a Local Economic Development Committee that has three main responsibilities: 1) review the local economic development plan in order to ensure diversification and sustainability of the economy; 2) plan and submit economic development projects to be funded by the central level; and 3) create and manage a Community Investment Fund that finances small income-generating projects in agriculture in the municipality. The expected results for the municipality are: 1) increased income and standards of living of men, women and youth from 875 families; 2) enhanced institutional capacity of local authorities towards economic development; and 3) improved cross-sector partnerships for community development. / Le but du projet est d'amí©liorer le dí©veloppement í©conomique et social des foyers du district de Quiruvilca dans la rí©gion de La Libertad au Pí©rou en visant particuliíÂrement les femmes et les jeunes. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Vision Mondiale Canada travaille avec les autorití©s locales afin d'í©tablir un Comití© local de dí©veloppement í©conomique ayant trois responsabilití©s principales : 1) revoir le plan de dí©veloppement í©conomique local afin d'assurer la diversití© et la viabilití© de l'í©conomie, 2) planifier et soumettre des projets de dí©veloppement í©conomique íæ íÈtre financí©s au niveau central, 3) crí©er et gí©rer un Fonds d'investissement communautaire finaní€Œ_ant de petits projets gí©ní©rateurs de revenus en agriculture dans la municipalití©. Les rí©sultats escomptí©s pour la municipalití© sont : 1) une augmentation du revenu et de la qualití© de vie des hommes, femmes et jeunes provenant de 875 familles, 2) une capacití© institutionnelle rehaussí©e pour les autorití©s locales en matiíÂre de dí©veloppement í©conomique, 3) des partenariats de secteurs transversaux amí©liorí©s pour le dí©veloppement í©conomique.

title: Oxfam-Quí©bec - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / Oxfam-Quí©bec - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
short_description: OXFAM-QUí_BEC - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / OXFAM-QUí_BEC - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
long_description: This volunteer sending program is designed to send 530 volunteers in 16 developing countries. It aims to: (1) enable partners to provide women and men with the capacity to exercise their economic rights and to reduce their vulnerability to change; (2) enable civil society to establish effective dialogues with the government to identify policies and strategies that benefit vulnerable populations regarding the issues linked to essential health, education and drinking water services; (3) enable partners to strengthen women's leadership and increase their capacity to influence, to identify strategies that eliminate all forms of violence and discrimination towards them, to ensure the defence and the promotion of their rights, and to involve men in this regard; and (4) enable partners to better defend youth issues in local policies, to promote access to essential education and health services for youth, and make youth stakeholders in society. An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Ce programme d'envoi de volontaires permet l'envoi de 530 volontaires dans 16 pays en voie de dí©veloppement. Il vise íæ 1) habiliter les partenaires afin de donner aux femmes et aux hommes les capacití©s d'exercer leurs droits í©conomiques et íæ rí©duire leur vulní©rabilití© face aux changements, 2) habiliter la socií©tí© civile afin qu'elle soit en mesure d'í©tablir un dialogue efficace avec le gouvernement afin d'identifier des politiques et stratí©gies en faveur des populations vulní©rables sur les questions touchant les services essentiels en matiíÂre de santí©, d'í©ducation et d'eau potable, 3) habiliter les partenaires afin de renforcer le leadership des femmes et d'accroitre leur capacití© d'influence, d'identifier des stratí©gies pour í©liminer toute forme de violence et de discrimination íæ leur í©gard, d'assurer la dí©fense et la promotion de leurs droits et d'impliquer les hommes dans cette dí©marche, 4) habiliter les partenaires afin qu'ils soient en mesure de mieux dí©fendre la position des jeunes face aux politiques locales, de favoriser l'accíÂs des jeunes íæ des services essentiels d'í©ducation et de santí© et d'en faire des acteurs de la socií©tí©. title: Support to the Peruvian Tax Administration in the Field of Strategic Budgeting
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE PERUVIAN TAX ADMINISTRATION IN THE FIELD OF STRATEGIC BUDGETING
long_description: In recent years, the Peruvian Ministry of Finance (MEF) has focused its activities on the development of instruments aimed at improving the quality of public expenditure. In this context, the MEF has sought alternatives to increase efficiency in the allocation of resources by using tools such as multi-annual budgeting and performance-based budgeting. This project will fund the work of two consultants, who will be responsible for carrying out several studies for the Peruvian Tax Administration (SUNAT), where performance-based budgeting will be introduced from 2011. The main output will be the development of a strategic program aimed at expanding the tax base in Peru and the definition of key performance indicators.

short_description: TEACHER TRAINING
long_description: The project aims to improve quality education for indigenous and rural children, especially girls, in Southern Andean and Amazonian Peru through Intercultural Bilingual Education. CIDA's support enables UNICEF to expand its education program in Ayacucho, Amazonas, Apurí_mac, Cusco and Ucayali, regions characterized by extremely high poverty levels, indigenous populations, high prevalence of chronic malnutrition among children and overall lack of quality basic services, including health, education, water and sanitation. The project supports quality learning materials, training of teachers, school directors and education administrators, and strengthening the participation of parents and community members in the education system. The project aims to improve learning strategies, to develop models for replication in other regions and municipalities, and to contribute to the consolidation of regional government capacity to support a regional system of teacher training and to access national financial and technical resources. / Le projet a pour but d'amí©liorer la qualití© de l'í©ducation prodiguí©e aux enfants autochtones et íæ ceux habitant les rí©gions rurales, particuliíÂrement les filles, au sud des Andes pí©ruviennes ainsi que dans l'Amazonie pí©ruvienne, par le biais du programme í_ducation bilingue interculturelle. L'appui de l'ACDI permet íæ l'UNICEF d'í©largir le programme dans les rí©gions suivantes : Ayacucho, Amazonas, Apurí_mac, Cusco et Ucayali. Ces derniíÂres sont caractí©risí©es par des taux extríÈmement í©leví©s de pauvretí©, la prí©sence de populations autochtones, une prí©valence í©leví©e de malnutrition chronique chez les enfants, et le manque gí©ní©ralisí© de services essentiels de qualití©, y compris les soins de santí©, l'í©ducation, l'eau et l'assainissement. title: Prevention of Conflicts Over the Use of Natural Resources / Prí©vention des conflits lií©s íæ l'utilisation des ressources naturelles
short_description: PREVENTION OF CONFLICTS OVER THE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES / PRí_VENTION DES CONFLITS LIí_S íó L'UTILISATION DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES
long_description: Through this CIDA-funded project, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) aims to contribute to a stable economic environment for equitable and sustainable economic growth in Peru by reducing the economic and social impact of conflicts related to the use of natural resources. This project aims to achieve improved prevention and management of resource-based conflicts, and to complement CIDA's efforts in corporate social responsibility and natural resource management. The project provides technical assistance to state agencies, primarily the Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros (similar to Canada's Privy Council Office), regional governments, and other stakeholders on conflict prevention, management, and resolution. / Via cette initiative financí©e par l'ACDI, le Programme des Nations Unies pour le dí©veloppement (PNUD) vise íæ contribuer íæ la crí©ation d'un environnement stable pour le dí©veloppement í©conomique í©quitable et durable du Pí©rou en rí©duisant l'impact socio-í©conomique des conflits lií©s íæ l'utilisation des ressources naturelles. title: Design of a skill strengthening model on planning based on MfDR of the public institutions with which the AECID works for the improvement of aid efficiency.
short_description: DESIGN OF A SKILL STRENGTHENING MODEL ON PLANNING BASED ON MFDR OF THE PUBLIC INSTITUTIONS WITH WHICH THE AECID WORKS FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF AID EFFI
long_description: El proyecto tiene como finalidad mejorar la eficacia de la ayuda de las intervenciones de desarrollo financiadas por la AECID y gestionadas por sus OTC a traví©s de las instituciones pí_blicas de los paí_ses receptores. Para definir el objetivo especí_fico de la presente investigacií_n, se ha tenido muy en cuenta la experiencia y los trabajos previos de los miembros del equipo proponente. En concreto, a partir de investigaciones previas se han identificado tres situaciones que debilitan la eficacia de la ayuda y que van en la lí_nea de las debilidades encontradas en la segunda Evaluacií_n de la Declaracií_n de Parí_s de Mayo de 2011 donde se destaca la necesidad de fortalecer la capacidad de los socios en el íçmbito de la Gestií_n para Resultados de Desarrollo: äó¢ La falta de capacidades locales a pesar de las numerosas acciones de capacitacií_n; lo que hace suponer que es necesario identificar mejor las debilidades y fortalezas de las organizaciones locales para trabajar de forma rigurosa y sistematiza en su fortalecimiento de capacidades. äó¢ La dificultad que supone valorar el diseí±o y medir la contribucií_n al desarrollo de las intervenciones o programas que se llevan a cabo en un territorio. äó¢ La dificultad de definir y sistematizar la relacií_n entre los resultados de desarrollo y la capacidad institucional de las organizaciones ejecutoras (en la cadena de resultados de desarrollo). Las actividades de la presente propuesta, estíçn diseí±adas para dar respuesta a los tres puntos anteriores. Para ello se desarrollaríç un modelo que abarcaríç tanto el diagní_stico de las capacidades instituciones como de los indicadores de efectos de desarrollo de las intervenciones ejecutadas por las mismas. El modelo de diagní_stico de capacidades institucionales se centraríç en las capacidades de planificacií_n orientada a resultados de desarrollo para las instituciones pí_blicas con las que trabajan las OTC en terreno. Este diagní_stico permitiríç identificar fortalezas y debilidades de las instituciones pí_blicas con las que se trabaja o se quiere trabajar, identificando íçreas de mejora. El resultado de estos diagní_sticos permitiríç desarrollar un plan de fortalecimiento realista y adaptado a las necesidades de cada institucií_n. El modelo tambií©n contendríç un marco de indicadores de medicií_n de efectos de desarrollo de las intervenciones. Al trabajar con instituciones pí_blicas estos indicadores estaríçn ajustados a la ayuda bilateral directa, y cumpliríçn con un objetivo dual, por un lado permitiríçn valorar el diseí±o de la intervencií_n, y por otro lado evaluar los resultados de desarrollo a medio-largo plazo de la intervencií_n.

title: Supporting the Knowledge, Innovation and Development Program at FORO Nacional/Internacional, Peru
short_description: SUPPORTING THE KNOWLEDGE, INNOVATION AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM AT FORO NACIONAL/INTERNACIONAL, PERU
long_description: Recent policy initiatives suggest that efforts are underway to improve the traditionally limited support granted to science, technology and innovation (STI) activities in Peru. FORO Nacional/Internacional (FORO) is an independent thinktank based in Peru that specializes in research on STI policy. The project aims to strengthen FORO's capacities to do research, catalyze debate and influence STI and other social and economic policies underpinning inclusive and sustainable development for Peru. It will support a series of studies on new approaches to inclusive and sustainable development strategy, as it relates to knowledge and innovation. Special attention will be paid to activities that provide livelihoods - many in the informal sector - to the excluded and the disadvantaged. FORO will also participate in discussion of the role of knowledge and innovation in the concept and practice of development.

long_description: 10-CO1-048/PROSALUS/Bolivia y Perí_/$total inicial 5,42mä‰å/Seguridad Alimentaria Nutricional. La presente propuesta de Convenio pretende consolidar, profundizar y extender los logros de seis de los principales procesos de desarrollo que Prosalus impulsa en Perí_ y Bolivia, orientados al efectivo ejercicio de l os derechos humanos a la salud,a la alimentacií_n y al agua. Para ello, s e integran en un sí_lo programa las seis intervenciones para, desde este enfoque basado en derechos, dar continuidad al trabajo de incidencia en los determinantes de la salud de las comunidades de intervencií_n, especi almente la deficiente alimentacií_n y la desnutricií_n, que tiene un impac to sobre la salud y desarrollo vital de las personas, por lo que las int ervenciones persiguen garantizar la Seguridad Alimentaria Nutricional, c on enfoque de Soberaní_a, promoviendo la equidad de gí©nero, la sostenibil idad ambiental, la participacií_n activa de la poblacií_n en la construcci í_n y control social de las polí_ticas pí_blicas relacionadas, reforzando l a gobernabilidad local y fomentando mayor implicacií_n de las autoridades en el desarrollo rural (clave para la sostenibilidad y replicabilidad d e las iniciativas implementadas). Todas las intervenciones se llevan a c abo en íçmbito rural, en comunidades campesinas andinas situadas a gran a ltura, con condiciones climatolí_gicas adversas y alejadas de los centros de provisií_n de servicios. Para aprovechar el potencial siní©rgico entre las seis acciones, Prosalus ejerceríç un rol facilitador de procesos de reflexií_n estratí©gica y operativa, fomentando el debate sobre la estrate gia de intervencií_n al interior del Convenio con una visií_n global y en base a la experiencia en otros paí_ses, confiriendo cohesií_n a traví©s de, entre otras actividades conjuntas, intercambios de experiencias y accio nes deincidencia en polí_ticas pí_blicas de soberaní_a alimentaria y salud.

title: Economic entreprising for the promotion of female employment in Southern Lima.
short_description: ECONOMIC ENTREPRISING FOR THE PROMOTION OF FEMALE EMPLOYMENT IN SOUTHERN LIMA.
long_description: El proyecto se va a llevar a cabo en los distritos de Villa Marí_a del Triunfo, Lurí_n, Villa El Salvador, San Juan de Miraflores y Pachacamac.A pesar de la promulgacií_n en 2008 de la Ley nŒ_ 28983 de Igualdad de Oportunidades entre Mujeres y Hombres, son pocas las instancias de gestií_n del Estado que han incorporado en sus presupuestos la ejecucií_n de acciones concretas para contribuir a la Igualdad de Oportunidades. En el sondeo realizado sobre las dificultades identificadas para el diseí±o de proyectos, programas o actividades vinculadas a la Igualdad de oportunidades en gobiernos regionales, se observa como la causa míçs recurrente la falta de capacidades tí©cnicas.El proyecto pretende favorecer el avance hacia la igualdad de oportunidades en el acceso al empleo en los distritos arriba mencionados impulsando y promoviendo emprendimientos econí_micos en gastronomí_a, carpinterí_a y artesaní_a en 5 organizaciones de mujeres. Para ello se van a llevar a cabo las siguientes actividades:-Realizar un mí_dulo de formacií_n para el desarrollo de proyectos comunitarios de tipo econí_mico y capacidades personales con enfoque de gí©nero dirigido a 100 mujeres de 5 organizaciones.-Brindar asesorí_a tí©cnica a las organizaciones de mujeres para que formulen proyectos comunitarios de tipo econí_mico teniendo en cuenta los contextos socioeconí_micos locales. Esta asesorí_a se llevaríç a cabo por parte de funcionarios locales de íçreas de desarrollo econí_mico de las municipalidades conjuntamente con personal de Desco. Se espera obtener 25 propuestas que, una vez validadas se presentaríçn a los presupuestos participativos de cada distrito.-Organizar el concurso de proyectos denominado Fondo de Iniciativas de Proyectos de Inversií_n Social, mediante el cual se financiaríç a 10 emprendimientos manejados por mujeres de organizaciones e Lima Sur. Los proyectos financiados estaríçn articulados al Plan de Desarrollo Local y al Plan de Desarrollo Econí_mico de los distritos de Lima Sur y recibiríçn ademíçs asistencia tí©cnica para su implementacií_n.-Organizar la ejecucií_n de una Expo Feria Mujer en Lima Sur para dar difusií_n a los emprendimientos econí_micos de las mujeres. -- Geographical target area : El proyecto se va a llevar a cabo en los distritos de Villa Marí_a del Triunfo, Lurí_n, Villa El Salvador, San Juan de Miraflores y Pachacamac. --

title: Promotion of health education in 10 human settlements of Villa El Salvador PROMOSAN (Peru)
short_description: PROMOTION OF HEALTH EDUCATION IN 10 HUMAN SETTLEMENTS OF VILLA EL SALVADOR PROMOSAN (PERU)
long_description: El Proyecto: Promocií_n de la educacií_n sanitaria en 10 asentamientos humanos de Villa El Salvador (PROMOSAN), tiene como objetivo promover la instalacií_n adecuada de mí_dulos sanitarios de calidad al interior de los hogares de 2000 familias de 10 asentamientos humanos de Villa El Salvador. Asimismo el proyecto contribuiríç con el desarrollo de una cultura de agua a traví©s del acceso adecuado y oportuno a los servicios de agua potable y saneamiento. La conexií_n domiciliaria del agua y desagí_e estíç garantizada por el Programa Nacional Agua Para Todos, a pesar de esto, sí_lo el 10% de la poblacií_n llega a instalar mí_dulos sanitarios al interior de sus hogares. Aquí_ radica la importancia del proyecto pues los mí_dulos sanitarios y las conexiones internas de agua y desagí_e estíçn directamente relacionados a la calidad del agua que consume la gente y por lo tanto estíç relacionada a la disminucií_n de las enfermedades asociadas a este lí_quido elemento. El proyecto estíç conformado por cuatro componentes, el primero estíç referido a informacií_n y comunicacií_n sobre la importancia de contar con mí_dulos sanitarios de calidad al interior de los hogares para la salud de la familia; el segundo se refiere a la dinamizacií_n de la oferta de saneamiento de calidad en la zona de intervencií_n (venta, instalacií_n y mantenimiento de los mí_dulos sanitarios en los hogares); el tercero busca mejorar el acceso al crí©dito y la cultura del ahorra de las familias para la compra e instalacií_n de mí_dulos sanitarios y el cuarto busca desarrollar una polí_tica de educacií_n sanitaria en el distrito de Villa El Salvador llevando a cabo la campaí±a Villa El Salvador, Ciudad Ahorradora de Agua. El proyecto tambií©n se basa en el conocimiento del socio local sobre la zona de trabajo y la educacií_n sanitaria, así_ como en la experiencia de ECODES en el manejo de sistemas ahorradores y desarrollo de campaí±as de ahorro del agua.

title: Establishment of mobile health clinics / Mise en place de cliniques mobiles de santí©
short_description: ESTABLISHMENT OF MOBILE HEALTH CLINICS / MISE EN PLACE DE CLINIQUES MOBILES DE SANTí_
long_description: This project provides greater access to primary health care, including basic dental and gynecological services, to poor indigenous women and their families living in remote, mountainous areas of south-eastern Peru. Using three mobile clinics, professionals from private and public health institutions will tour villages to deliver quality health services to beneficiaries at substantially lower costs than market price. The project is in line with the Peruvian government's strategy to facilitate access to health care for poor and vulnerable populations and is complementary to Peru's national health insurance system. The project is implemented by Impact First International (formerly GEMS of Hope), in collaboration with Pro Mujer Peru. This is one of two parts of a project valued at $319,723. The first part has been completed. / Ce projet donne un meilleur accíÂs aux soins de santí© primaires, incluant des soins dentaires de base et des services gyní©cologiques, aux femmes autochtones pauvres et íæ leurs familles vivant dans des rí©gions reculí©es et montagneuses au sud-est du Pí©rou. Des professionnels d'institutions de santí© publiques et priví©es parcourent les villages avec trois cliniques mobiles et offrent des soins de santí© aux bí©ní©ficiaires íæ des coíéts beaucoup plus bas que ceux du marchí©. Le projet est en lien avec la stratí©gie du gouvernement pí©ruvien visant íæ faciliter l'accíÂs aux soins de santí© aux plus pauvres et vulní©rables de la socií©tí©. Il est complí©mentaire au systíÂme national d'assurance pour la santí©. Ce projet est mis en oeuvre par Impact First International (anciennement GEMS of Hope), en collaboration avec Pro Mujer Peru. Il s'agit d'une des deux parties d'un projet d'une valeur totale de 319 723 $. La premiíÂre partie est terminí©e.

title: Public Policy and Public Sector Reform Fund / Fonds pour la rí©forme du secteur public et de la politique publique
short_description: PUBLIC POLICY AND PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM FUND / FONDS POUR LA Rí_FORME DU SECTEUR PUBLIC ET DE LA POLITIQUE PUBLIQUE
long_description: This is a responsive fund administered directly by CIDA's team at the Canadian Embassy in Lima, Peru. It provides flexible and rapid support to small-scale initiatives by public, private, and civil society organizations and institutions to improve the performance and accountability of Peru's public sector. The initiatives funded improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Peru's public sector, and strengthen the Government of Peru's capacity to design and implement sound public policies, regulations, and public services. The initiatives address, for example, strengthening democracy and the rule of law; citizens' advocacy and participation in decision-making; institutionalizing strategic planning; strengthening the decentralization process; strengthening ethics and transparency and eradicating corruption; and promoting equality of opportunities. / Ce fonds rí©actif est gí©rí© directement par l'í©quipe de l'ACDI íæ l'ambassade du Canada íæ Lima, au Pí©rou. Il offre aux institutions et aux organismes publics, priví©s ou de la socií©tí© civile un mí©canisme souple et rapide de financement de petites initiatives qui visent une amí©lioration du rendement et de l'imputabilití© du secteur public pí©ruvien. Les projets financí©s accroissent l'efficience et l'efficacití© du secteur public et renforcent la capacití© du Gouvernement du Pí©rou d'í©laborer et de mettre en oeuvre des politiques publiques saines, une bonne rí©glementation et de bons services au public. Ils traitent par exemple des sujets suivants : le renforcement de la dí©mocratie et de l'í©tat de droit; le parrainage civique et la participation de la population au processus dí©cisionnel; l'institutionnalisation de la planification stratí©gique; le processus de dí©centralisation; l'í©thique, la transparence et l'í©radication de la corruption; la promotion d'une plus grande í©galití© des chances.

title: UNITERRA Cooperation Programme - (Consortium EUMC/CECI)-2009 / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire UNITERRA (Consortium EUMC/CECI)- 2009
short_description: UNITERRA COOPERATION PROGRAMME - (CONSORTIUM EUMC/CECI)-2009 / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE UNITERRA (CONSORTIUM EUMC/CECI)- 2009
long_description: The program aims to create partnerships between Canadian and developing-country organizations committed to local development. Through volunteer sending, Uniterra helps to mobilize local communities around development policies. Uniterra sends volunteers to 14 countries: Botswana, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Guinea, Malawi, Mali, Niger, Senegal, Bolivia, Guatemala, Peru, Nepal, Sri Lanka, and Vietnam. In each country, Uniterra strategically targets two of the following key sectors: agriculture and rural development, basic education, health and nutrition, HIV/AIDS, youth programs, and private-sector development. This transition phase aims to implement the strategy for the April-June 2009 transition between the current Uniterra program and the 2009-2014 program scheduled to start up in July 2009. The objectives for this period are: Continue efforts to build the capacities of partners in the countries and sectors planned for the 2009-2014 period. Begin to focus programming on fewer sectors and start up activities in new sectors. Implement targeted public engagement activities. Systematize lessons learned and best practices. Begin to update strategies. Plan the reorganization of teams in Canada and in the field to implement the 2009-2014 program (subject to CIDA approval). / Le programme vise íæ crí©er des partenariats entre des organisations engagí©es dans le dí©veloppement local, au Canada et dans les pays du Sud. Par l'envoi de volontaires, UNITERRA soutient la mobilisation des populations locales aux orientations du dí©veloppement. Des volontaires seront envoyí©s dans quatorze pays : Botswana, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Guiní©e, Malawi, Mali, Niger, Sí©ní©gal, Bolivie, Guatemala, Pí©rou, Ní©pal, Sri Lanka et Vietnam. Uniterra vise stratí©giquement deux secteurs clí©s dans chaque pays parmi ceux-ci : l'agriculture et le dí©veloppement rural; l'í©ducation de base; la santí© et la nutrition; le VIH/sida; les programmes pour les jeunes; le dí©veloppement du secteur priví©. long_description: SUCO's three-month VCP program proposal aims to consolidate the achievements of the five-year program that ended on March 31, 2009. SUCO will also help Canadians to learn more about, and become more involved in, development and solidarity among peoples. title: Centre for Occupational Education (COE) / Centre d'í©ducation professionnelle (CEP)
short_description: CENTRE FOR OCCUPATIONAL EDUCATION (COE) / CENTRE D'í_DUCATION PROFESSIONNELLE (CEP)
long_description: This project seeks to improve the level of education and the employment prospects of disadvantaged adults, particularly women, living in the District of Chincha. The project aims to rebuild the facilities of the Centre for Occupational Education (COE) that were destroyed in the 2007 earthquake and to provide women and men with basic education, educational upgrade, and life skills programs on topics such as communication, leadership, and money management. These skills enable them to access the COE's vocational and technical programs and to find better-paying employment opportunities. The courses given within this project are supplemented by workshops and debates open to the public, particularly the male population, on the importance of giving women the same employment opportunities available to men, sexual harassment issues in the workplace, and other related topics. This is one of two parts of a project valued at $500,000. The first part has been completed. / Ce projet vise íæ amí©liorer le niveau d'í©ducation et les perspectives d'emploi des adultes dí©favorisí©s, en particulier les femmes, du district de Chincha. Le projet a pour but de reconstruire les installations du Centre d'í©ducation professionnelle (CEP) qui a í©tí© dí©truit par un tremblement de terre en 2007 et de fournir aux femmes et aux hommes marginalisí©s des cours d'í©ducation de base, de perfectionnement et des programmes d'apprentissage d'autonomie quotidienne, tels des cours en communication, en leadership et en gestion financiíÂre personnelle. Cette formation leur permet d'accí©der aux programmes professionnels et techniques du CEP et d'obtenir des emplois plus rí©muní©rateurs. Des ateliers et des dí©bats accessibles au public viennent complí©ter la formation. Ces ateliers et ces dí©bats, qui ciblent plus particuliíÂrement les hommes, portent sur l'importance d'accorder une chance í©gale d'emploi aux femmes, sur les problíÂmes d'harcíÂlement sexuel en milieu de travail et sur d'autres sujets connexes. Il s'agit d'une des deux parties d'un projet d'une valeur totale de 500 000 $. La premiíÂre partie est terminí©e.

donor: World Bank - International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)
title: Water Resources Management Modernization
short_description: Water, sanitation and flood protection (General water, sanitation and flood protection sector): 50, Agriculture, fishing, and forestry (Irrigation and drainage): 50
long_description: The proposed lending instrument is a Specific Investment Loan (SIL) of US$ 10 million over a five year period. The overall project cost is estimated at US$ 33.67 million, including a parallel IDB financing of US$ 10 million. It would be implemented through the following components:Component 1. Strengthening WRM capacity at the national level (total cost US$ 6.30 million) This component aims at improving the institutional capacity at the central level to facilitate/support integrated, participatory WRM at the basin level. It will include five subcomponents:Sub-component 1.1. Capacity building of the newly created ANA (total cost US$ 1.99 million): The Project will build the capacity of the newly created ANA by supporting a core team, including both administrative and technical staff. The team will provides the foundation for basin-scale, participatory, integrated WRM in this institution and will be maintained once the Project closes. It will also be responsible for overall Project implementation.Sub-component 1.2. National Strategy for WRM Financing (total cost US$ 0.2 million).The Project will support the formulation of a strategy for financing WRM at the national and river basin levels, considering the user-pays and polluter-pays principles.Sub-component 1.3. Creation of a national water information system (total cost US$ 2.09 million).The Project will support the design and implementation of a national water information system that will integrate into one single information system, water-related data and information currently dispersed among various institutions.Sub-component 1.4. National Water Quality Management Strategy (total cost US$ 0.20 million). The Project will support the formulation of a national strategy for water quality management, considering water quality monitoring, discharge control and enforcement.Sub-component 1.5. Program to Promote a New 'Water Culture' (total cost US$ 1.82 million).The Project will support ANA in the design and launch of a program aimed at promoting a new 'water culture' among decision makers, water professionals and the general plint. It will also support the capacity building of water professionals and decision-makers in WRM, in particular those directly involved in the implementation and/or monitoring of the Project activities at the river basin level supported under component 2, including officials from ANA and its local offices (AAA), regional governments, SENAMHI and DIGESA.Component 2. Improving WRM in selected River Basins (Total cost: US$ 27.35 million, IBRD loan: US$ 7.22 million, IDB loan: US$ 10 million)Sub-component 2.1. Implementation of participatory, IWRM in selected pilot river basins (total cost US$ 26.62 million).The Project will support, in selected river basins, the creation and/or strengthening and early operation of:(a) the local ANA offices (AAA), that will constitute the River Basin Authority;(b) the River Basin Councils (CCs) and their technical working groups, as the entities to ensure stakeholders participation and to line-up political support;(c) regional offices of DIGESA, called Direccií€Œ_n Ejecutivas de la Salud Ambiental (DESAs), responsible for water quality management and(d) regional offices of SENAMHI, responsible for the generation of hydro-meteorological information.This will include:(a) the design of the institutional organization, composition and functions of AAA and CC in each river basin based on the local context, including the coordination and accountability mechanisms between these entities and other stakeholders;(b) the development of operational management instruments for AAAs (e.g. operational manual, planning and budgeting manual, administrative and accounting software; monitoring and evaluation plan); and(c) setting-up and financing a local core team in each of the involved AAA/river basins.A key activity will also be the definition of the financing mechanisms (in line with the strategy developed in sub-component 1.2) detailing how water users and polluters, and central, regional and local governments would participate in the financing of WRM in each of the selected pilot basins. In addition, the Project would finance the development/strengthening of key WRM instruments, including:(a) the formulation of a detailed participatory, integrated WRM plans for each of the pilot river basin;(b) bulk water distribution models and decision aid tools, including hydrological and hydrogeological models and scenario simulation models to be used in developing the IWRM plans and for flood (including alert systems) and drought management and adaptation to climate change;(c) plan for the operation and maintenance of major hydraulic infrastructure, including dam safety procedures;(d) improvements of the hydro-meteorological and hydrological observation networks;(e) improvements to water user rights administration through the development of procedures and their implementation in the six river basins for the formalization of non-agricultural water rights and monitoring of users compliance and enforcing the terms and condition of water rights entitlements;(f) design and implementation of surface and groundwater quality monitoring and discharge control programs in the Chili pilot basin;(g) training of trainers in the 'new water culture' to create a critical mass of motivated and competent professional staff that would promote, design and implement awareness raising campaigns aimed at improving people habits and practices related to water use and encouraging their participation in river basin management and(h) financing small high priority structural or non structural activities, as defined in the integrated WRM plans that may include upper watershed protection to control erosion and river embankment protection.Sub-component 2.2. Sensitization to the creation of river basin organizations in four River Basins and validation of IWRM plans (total cost US$ 0.73 million).It is expected that the experience gained in the pilot river basins under sub-component 2.1 will eventually be extended to other basins in the country. The purpose of this component is to prepare the groundwork in 4 river basins for the creation of CCs as a locus for participation and consensus building among all stakeholders in the water sector around an IWRM plan for their river basin. These 4 river basins are, tentatively: Puyango-Tumbes; Jequetepeque; Chancay-Huaral; and Moqueta-Tambo.

Son los departamento, provincias y distritos de Lima (Lima/Villa Marí_a del Triunfo y Pachacamac), Juní_n (Tarma/Tarma), Huancavelica (Castrovirreyna/Castrovirreyna y Huancavelica/ Huancavelica) y Loreto (Maynas/Belí©n e Iquitos).Este proyecto pretende recoger la experiencia de organizacií_n e incidencia de los colectivos de NATs (Nií±os, nií±as y adolescentes trabajadores) organizados y de municipios escolares a nivel nacional, articulando las organizaciones de NNA para que puedan llegar a ejercer una ciudadaní_a protagonista con actores estratí©gicos de la localidad, provincia y/o regií_n y así_ poder movilizar procesos de desarrollo comunitario. Deze post wil eveneens nagaan of Ecuador kan worden opgenomen in de lijst voor multidonor-overleg, en wel om volgende redenen: 1. Belgi? is ??n van de belangrijkste bilaterale donoren in Ecuador (4e donor na VS, Spanje en EU)2. Met de oprichting van een nieuw Agentschap voor Internationale Samenwerking wordt verwacht dat de donorco?rdiantie (in het verleden erg zwak), zal worden ge?ntensiveerd.3. Ook binnen de EU is de discussie rond de Code of Conduct en werkverdeling gestart. In 2009 wordt door de Commissie een PEFA georganiseerd. Deze post zal hieraan deelnemen.4. Er is een actief overleg tussen Belgische actoren, met functionerende web-site (www.fabec.org.ec).Concerne : Utilisation en 2009 de l'allocation de base 1454041227R?f?rence : VM 2008/1973 du 25/11/08. Ce poste demande l'attribution d'un visa provisionnel de 5.000 euros destin? ? couvrir les co?ts des structures de coordination pour 2009. Le Bureau CD vous serait reconnaissant de bien vouloir engager une premi?re tranche de 2.500 ?. Ce visa sera utilis? en premier lieu pour l'organisation des sessions du Forum des Acteurs Belges de la Coop?ration au P?rou (FABEP), 2 ? 3 fois par an. Par ailleurs, le Bureau de Coop?ration souhaiterait ?tre ?galement pris en compte pour l'attribution d'une enveloppe provisionnelle pour les activit?s multi-donateurs. La Belgique figure en effet parmi le groupe de t?te des bailleurs d'aide bilat?rale non remboursable au P?rou (derri?re les Etats-Unis, l'Union europ?enne, l'Espagne, le Canada et le Japon), et cette position se renforcera ? partir de la prochaine Commission mixte, pr?vue d?but 2009, et de l'entr?e en vigeur du prochain PIC. Notre pays joue d?s ? pr?sent un r?le pionnier dans les nouvelles modalit?s de l'aide, en particulier gr?ce ? l'appui financier sectoriel fourni au SIS (Sistema Integral de Salud). Une participation active de la coop?ration belge ? de nouvelles formes de soutien de type financier et sectoriel, dans ce m?me secteur sant? ainsi que dans un secteur additionnel, devrait ?tre ? l'ordre du jour lors de la prochaine Commission mixte. Par exemple, le soutien financier au SIS devrait ?tre ?largi de mani?re ? couvrir l'ensemble du domaine de l'assurance sant? universelle (droit aux soins de sant?), un horizon vers lequel le P?rou est en train de progresser, avec l'aide de la communaut? internationale. Divers bailleurs, bilat?raux comme multi-lat?raux, parmi lesquels USAID et la Banque interam?ricaine de D?veloppement, contribuent avec la Belgique au forum de coordination qui promeut l'?volution dans ce domaine. Dans d'autres secteurs (gestion durable de ressources naturelles) la Belgique pourrait poursuivre (en fonction des d?cisions de la CM) une strat?gie similaire, harmonis?e en particulier avec la politique de coo

title: More decent jobs in Peru: strengthening research and policymaking capacities
short_description: MORE DECENT JOBS IN PERU: STRENGTHENING RESEARCH AND POLICYMAKING CAPACITIES
long_description: Despite growth, labour markets in Peru do not generate better jobs for all. Working closely with the Ministry of Labour, this project will identify key evidence gaps, propose policy options and build capacities to tackle labour market challenges in Peru. Peru has recently experienced very high growth rates. However, less than 30% of its workers had access to social security and other labour rights in 2009. This makes Peru one of the three countries in the region with the least social protection coverage for its workers. Also, despite a general increase in productivity and growth, there is still a significant difference in productivity between non-registered and registered firms. Some estimates suggest a 1 to 7 ratio between the average output per worker for the un-registered and registered enterprises. This translates in lower labour incomes for workers in un-registered firms. Recent experience suggests that Peru's labour markets challenges cannot be solved with growth alone. Peru has complex, segmented labour markets with respect to gender and ethnicity. Deeper understanding of the role of labour legislation, gender discrimination, social security, rural labor markets dynamics, among others, are required to inform better public policies to generate more decent jobs in Peru. Better understanding of Peru labour markets requires appropriate data. The current labour information system needs to be redesigned as information and coverage diverge amongst the regions in the country. There are very weak capacities for labour market analysis, especially in the public sector, but also in the academia (particularly in the regions outside of Lima). And while there is increasing expertise in Lima-based research centres, the analysis has not incorporated lessons learnt from other experiences in the region.This project responds to a demand from the Labour Ministry and is proposing to tackle these challenges by 1) identifying key knowledge gaps on labour market challenges through a series of discussions involving the Ministry, representatives from the private sector, trade unions and academics; 2) producing papers to tackle the identified research questions; 3) developing a proposal for a harmonized labour market information system including a gender lens; 4) facilitating evidence-based policy debates between the academia, policymakers, private sector representatives and trade unions; 5) supporting the development of labour market analytical capacities amongst younger researchers from the regions in Peru and policymakers and technical advisors; and 6) contributing to awareness raising on labour market challenges through engaging with the media and developing various dissemination tools.

title: Improving diagnosis and surgical care capacity in the San Juan de Dios Clinic Home, Lima
short_description: MEDICAL SERVICES
long_description: El Hogar Clí_nica San Juan de dios (en adelante, HCSJD) es un centro sanitario situado en Lima, perteneciente a la Orden Hospitalaria de San Juan de Dios. Atiende a 23604 pacientes anuales (2008), con una media de 931 pacientes por dí_a. El HCSJD estíç especializado en Rehabilitacií_n, ortopedia y Traumatologí_a, especialidad que tiene por fin, tratar las enfermedades del aparato locomotor y neuromuscular. Las intervenciones quirí_rgicas míçs recurrentes del centro sanitario son precisamente las que tienen que ver con í©sta especialidad mí©dica, las cuales sumaron el 79% del total de las operaciones en el 2008. El íÅrea de Rayos X del HCSJD generí_ en 2008, 12860 atenciones anuales. Precisamente este nivel de especializacií_n mí©dica hace prioritario contar con un buen equipamiento de diagní_stico para ajustar las terapias y la intervenciones hacia aquellos aspectos que realmente necesitan ser mejor tratados. El proyecto pretende mejorar la capacidad diagní_stica del HCSJD, a traví©s de la renovacií_n y mantenimiento de su servicio de Rayos X. La obsolescencia tecnolí_gica y la antigí_edad de los equipos mí©dicos de Rayos X y la sala de Operaciones del centro, los cuales han excedido su vida í_til para atender la demanda, limitan la capacidad de diagní_stica y dificultan que los recursos humanos puedan realizar los procedimientos y exíçmenes radiolí_gicos de manera apropiada. El pí_blico objetivo del HCSJD son nií±os y nií±as, adolescentes y jí_venes de hasta 26 aí±os de edad, con malformaciones congí©nitas o secuelas de paríçlisis cerebral, que requieren cirugí_as especializadas y que proceden de familias pobres o de pobreza extrema, que en su mayprí_a radican en zonas rurales, alto-andinas o urbano-marginales. Entre las actividades previstas estíç la adquisicií_n de equipos nuevos así_ como de equipamiento complementario con lo que mejoran los diagní_sticos y la capacidad asistencial quirí_rgica del centro.

title: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
short_description: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
long_description: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men. The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise íæ contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rí©gionales íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et au dí©veloppement durable dans 13 pays en dí©veloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est axí© sur le renforcement des capacití©s de 225 organisations clí©s du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí© et de l'í©ducation. Plus particuliíÂrement, il vise íæ : amí©liorer l'accíÂs aux services de santí© et d'í©ducaion, aux marchí©s et íæ la participation politique; favoriser l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rí©gionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí©, de l'í©ducation et de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes. Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'í©tude et de coopí©ration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).
