title: Promoting bioactive compounds in the Andean food materials and diets
short_description: PROMOTING BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS IN THE ANDEAN FOOD MATERIALS AND DIETS
long_description: The objective of this capacity- building project is to improve the skills of UNALMäó»s (Universidad Nacional Agraria) academic staff to produce and disseminate new knowledge to academia, authorities, consumers and industry about properties of Andean and Amazonian native edible plants and their use in promotion of nutrition. Peru has a vast amount of unexploited native food crops with potentially high nutritious and health-promoting properties. There is an acute need to characterize the potential health benefits of native food plants and promote their more efficient use for improvement of nutrition of Andean and Amazonian people. These activities require building of human and infrastructure capacity in the field of food and nutrition sciences.

title: Improving the basic health and educational quality conditions for a sustainable human development of the people in the Lalaquiz district, Piura.
short_description: IMPROVING THE BASIC HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL QUALITY CONDITIONS FOR A SUSTAINABLE HUMAN DEVELOPMENT OF THE PEOPLE IN THE LALAQUIZ DISTRICT, PIURA.
long_description: El proyecto es continuidad de las acciones iniciadas en el 2007 por FIAD y Albihar en el distrito de Lalaquiz para contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus habitantes de forma sostenible con equidad de gí©nero. _x000D_Lalaquiz es una zona andina excluida del norte del Perí_, con altos í_ndices de pobreza (74.6%) y desnutricií_n (38%) y bajos niveles de educacií_n. La poblacií_n beneficiaria es de 1670 personas (796 mujeres y 874 hombres). Las acciones previstas estíçn dirigidas a la mejora de las condiciones de saneamiento bíçsico y la calidad educativa, todas con un enfoque transversal de equidad de gí©nero, sobre la base de 4 resultados: _x000D_1)Se construye un sistema de abastecimiento de agua potable en el caserí_o La Laguna y se ponen los medios para que la poblacií_n lo haga sostenible; 2)La poblacií_n mejora conocimientos y príçcticas en temas higií©nicos, preventivo- sanitarios y conservacií_n del medio ambiente; 3)Se mejora la calidad de la educacií_n pí_blica rural en 3 caserí_os del distrito (La Laguna, Papayo y Maray Grande) acercíçndolos a las nuevas tecnologí_as; 4)Se visibiliza y fortalece el papel de la mujer en el desarrollo comunal y de la familia, en equidad con el varí_n._x000D_El sistema de abastecimiento de agua potable disminuiríç las enfermedades gastrointestinales, ademíçs se busca concienciar a mujeres y varones en príçcticas sanitarias y ambientales saludables en todos los íçmbitos. Se pretende innovar la educacií_n, mediante la novedosa incorporacií_n de tecnologí_as de la informacií_n en las escuelas pí_blicas secundarias del distrito acompaí±ados de un programa de capacitacií_n en computacií_n e informíçtica para docentes y alumnos/as de secundaria. Se fomentaríç la participacií_n de la poblacií_n en la conformacií_n de organizaciones capaces del autosostenimiento de los servicios instalados. _x000D_Todas las acciones cuentan con la participacií_n y apoyo de la Municipalidad de Lalaquiz._x000D_

title: SEMEURS DE COMPŒêTENCES - Am?lioration des comp?tences des petits agriculteurs et renforcement des capacit?s p?dagogiques et de gestion des organismes de formation agricole
short_description: SEMEURS DE COMPŒêTENCES - AM?LIORATION DES COMP?TENCES DES PETITS AGRICULTEURS ET RENFORCEMENT DES CAPACIT?S P?DAGOGIQUES ET DE GESTION DES ORGANISMES
long_description: Le Programme ''Un m?tier pour tous'', 2011-2013, de l'ONG ACTEC se situe dans la continuit? du Programme pr?c?dent 2008-2010. Il constitue la deuxi?me phase de la mise en ?uvre du Cadre strat?gique 2008-2013 de l'ONG. Le Programme se caract?rise par une mission clairement ?nonc?e, une m?thode de travail bien ?labor?e et des r?sultats attendus, tr?s concrets. L'ONG vise ? renforcer le r?le et l'autonomie de personnes d?favoris?es par l'apprentissage d'un m?tier: ''le m?tier permet de changer leur vie''. La plupart des objectifs sp?cifiques (OS) visent l?am?lioration du niveau de vie de groupes particuli?rement vuln?rables comme les enfantsdes rues, les habitants de bidonvilles, les ''communaut?s indig?nes'', les personnes handicap?es. Le nombre total de b?n?ficiaires directs pr?vus par le Programme s??l?ve ? 74.711(d'apr?s nos calculs).Le programme est marqu? par une forte concentration th?matique : la formation pour un emploi. Il comporte trois types d'OS au b?n?fice des personnes pauvres : la cr?ation et/ou le renforcement de formations techniques et professionnelles ; le d?veloppement de programmes d'appui aux micro-entrepreneurs et le lancement de programmes innovateurs de formation professionnelle. Des ''Bureaux de l'emploi'' et le suivi de b?n?ficiaires des formations permettent d'assurer une certaine p?rennisation de l'enseignement dans le monde ?conomique. Le soutien aux micro-entreprises est constitu? de 3 composantes principales : (i) formation et micro-MBA ; (ii) micro-cr?dits ; (iii) assistance technique et micro-consultance. Les groupes-cibles sont les jeunes, les femmes et les micro-entrepreneurs en g?n?ral. Ces personnes sont compl?tement impliqu?es dans le projet, y compris financi?rement, car sans leur apport en temps et en argent, les actions ne sont pas viables. La participation financi?re qui leur est demand?e est adapt?e ? leurs possibilit?s. La formation technique et professionnelle vise ? enseigner un m?tier ou ? am?liorer son exercice. Elle doit permettre au b?n?ficiaire d'obtenir un meilleur poste de travail et l'augmentation de ses revenus. La formation g?n?rale, familiale et communautaire a pour objectif une am?lioration des comportements (hygi?ne, alimentation, salubrit?) et des attitudes (solidarit? familiale, participation citoyenne et d?veloppement communautaire). Am?lioration de l'autonomie et des conditions socio-?conomiques des populations vuln?rables ? travers l'apprentissage d'un m?tier au Congo, Burundi, Cameroun, Guatemala, Colombie, P?rou, Venezuela, Liban, Ha?ti et Equateur Am?lioration des comp?tences des petits agriculteurs et renforcement des capacit?s p?dagogiques et de gestion des organismes de formation agricole 1) Formation de petits agriculteurs, hommes et femmes, dans le but d?am?liorer leurscomp?tences et leurs capacit?s agricoles et de gestion- Cours de comp?tences professionnelles techniques et entrepreneuriales pour 100 petitsagriculteurs (10 mois);- D?veloppement des capacit?s agricoles

title: Oxfam Quebec Voluntary Cooperation Program 2009 / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec
short_description: OXFAM QUEBEC VOLUNTARY COOPERATION PROGRAM 2009 / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE 2009 D'OXFAM-QUí_BEC
long_description: This three-month program will bridge the current program (VCP 2004-2009) and the ''Mieux agir, Mieux influencer'' [more effective action, greater impact] program (VCP 2009-2014). The program is designed to provide an ideal forum to implement activities in preparation for a larger program, and to consider new planning and performance measurement frameworks for the Volunteer Cooperation Program. Through the Volunteer Cooperation Program, Oxfam-Quí©bec aims to help communities in developing countries to initiate or consolidate processes of endogenous development to address major problems relating to poverty and injustice. On the one hand, the program will aim to achieve measurable and tangible results (changes) in the lives of people and organizations (Mieux agir). On the other hand, the program will enable NGOs to build their capacities for dialogue and cooperation with other stakeholders. This will involve making data available during the next program, so that NGOs can become more influential, based on accurate information about the needs of communities, and thus increase the potential impact of public policy (Mieux influencer). In this regard, priority will be given to carrying out studies to provide more effective support for the engagement of partners in specific sectors. During the period, Oxfam-Quí©bec will maintain and continue to strengthen its engagement in five areas of intervention, whose objectives for change focus on basic human rights. These areas are: Economic justice: women entrepreneurs, agricultural development (especially food security), and the private sector - Essential services: access to basic education, access to water and sanitation, improvement of health - Rights in crisis: rights of communities that are victims of humanitarian crises - Gender justice: violence against women and women's rights - Empowerment of youth (crosscutting theme) / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec Le programme de coopí©ration volontaire de trois (3) mois d'Oxfam-Quí©bec vise íæ renforcer son intervention dans cinq secteurs d'intervention dont les objectifs de changement s'articulent autour des droits fondamentaux de la personne. Ces secteurs sont: la justice í©conomique et plus particuliíÂrement l'entrepreneuriat fí©minin, le dí©veloppement agricole (la sí©curití© alimentaire et le secteur priví©); les services essentiels de base, tel que l'accíÂs íæ l'í©ducation de base, l'accíÂs íæ l'eau et íæ l'assainissement, l'amí©lioration de la santí©; les droits en situation de crise, tel que le droit des populations victimes de crise humanitaire; ainsi que l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes, plus particuliíÂrement la violence faite aux femmes et les droits des femmes

long_description: El proyecto apuesta por la prevencií_n de la violencia de gí©nero y la promocií_n de una cultura de respeto a los derechos de las mujeres en dos provincias del Perí_: Huancavelica (en Huancavelica) y Chachapoyas (en Amazonas), comprometiendo para ello a periodistas, comunicadores y lí_deres de opinií_n. Con estos actores se impulsaríçn iniciativas comunicativas y educativas a fin de informar y sensibilizar a la poblacií_n sobre las percepciones, los prejuicios y mitos que hay sobre el tema; se generaríçn espacios de debate pí_blico sobre las desigualdades de gí©nero y la violencia -como una expresií_n de relaciones asimí©tricas de poder y una cultura machista que la naturaliza y justifica- afectando a las mujeres y nií±as; la finalidad es colocar este tema esencial como elemento constitutivo de la agenda del desarrollo. Los periodistas tambií©n haríçn seguimiento al cumplimiento de las polí_ticas pí_blicas de igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres, en lo referido al impulso de planes y servicios especializados en el campo de la violencia de gí©nero, vinculíçndolos a los indicadores de gí©nero y periodismo._x000D_Ademíçs, el proyecto va a brindar orientacií_n a las familias en situacií_n de riesgo de las zonas rurales y periurbanas para que accedan a servicios de atencií_n a traví©s de los actores locales en alianza con lí_deres de opinií_n y periodistas. Para lograr impactar en la poblacií_n, se emplearíç el enfoque intercultural, de educacií_n y entretenimiento, que busca acercar los mensajes de una manera amigable al pí_blico._x000D_El estudio de las percepciones de la poblacií_n sobre la violencia de gí©nero, así_ como la sistematizacií_n de la experiencia, permitiríç elaborar una propuesta de trabajo comunicativa en el campo de la prevencií_n de la violencia de gí©nero en zonas rurales y periurbanas, incidiendo en los gobiernos locales, provinciales y el Ministerio de la mujer y Desarrollo Social.

title: Enabling Local Ownership of Development / Facilitation de la prise en charge locale du dí©veloppement
short_description: CIVILIAN PEACE-BUILDING, CONFLICT PREVENTION AND RESOLUTION
long_description: The program responds to poverty, needs and challenges faced by vulnerable populations. Inter Pares carries out this program by strengthening the capacities of counterpart organizations in Africa, Asia, Latin America and Canada to develop activities that enhance the well-being of people in terms of livelihoods, health, food security, environmental sustainability and human rights. Inter Pares works towards these goals in four ways: by supporting organizations in Southern countries whose work addresses the structural causes of under-development; by supporting women to make their lives and work visible and empower them in their role as leaders and agents of change; by promoting institutional, national or international policies which create enabling conditions to improve the prospects for effective development, locally, nationally and globally; by learning from these efforts, making them known to Canadians, and building support for Canada's role in international cooperation and development. Activities take place at four levels: (1) support to counterparts to improve organizational effectiveness (governance, administration, management, accountability); (2) support to counterparts to plan, implement and assess program initiatives; (3) support to counterparts in developing and evaluating strategies to influence practice and policy for sustainable development; and (4) development of public engagement strategies in Canada to promote understanding and support for Canada's role in international development. / Le programme rí©pond íæ la pauvretí©, aux besoins et aux dí©fis auxquels font face les populations vulní©rables. Inter Pares met en oeuvre ce programme en renforí_ant les capacití©s de ses organisations partenaires en Afrique, en Asie, en Amí©rique Latine et au Canada, afin de dí©velopper des activití©s qui rehaussent le bien-íÈtre des gens en terme de moyens de subsistance, de santí©, de sí©curití© alimentaire, de viabilití© de l'environnement et des droits de la personne. Inter Pares travaille íæ atteindre ces objectifs de quatre faí_ons : en soutenant les organisations du Sud dont le travail rí©pond aux causes structurelles du sous-dí©veloppement; en soutenant les femmes dans leurs efforts íæ rendre leurs vies et leur travail visibles, tout en favorisant leur autonomie dans des ríÇles de leaders et d'agents du changement; en favorisant les politiques institutionnelles, nationales ou internationales qui crí©ent des conditions favorables íæ l'amí©lioration des possibilití©s pour un dí©veloppement efficace íæ l'í©chelle locale, nationale et mondiale; en tirant des leí_ons de ces efforts, faisant en sorte qu'elles soient connues des Canadiens et en dí©veloppant le soutien au ríÇle du Canada en coopí©ration et en dí©veloppement international. Les activití©s se dí©roulent íæ quatre niveaux : 1) soutien aux partenaires dans l'amí©lioration de l'efficacití© organisationnelle (gouvernance, administration, gestion, responsabilití©); 2) soutien aux partenaires dans la planification, la mise en oeuvre et l'í©valuation d'initiatives de programme; 3) soutien aux partenaires dans le dí©veloppement et l'analyse de stratí©gies pour influencer les pratiques et les politiques en matiíÂre de dí©veloppement durable; 4) dí©veloppement de stratí©gies d'engagement du public au Canada afin de promouvoir la comprí©hension et le soutien du ríÇle du Canada dans le dí©veloppement international.

title: Training in analysis of social problems from a human rights focus- Tools for cooperation.

long_description: Se presenta un programa de formacií_n interuniversitaria, dirigido a personas interesadas en la cooperacií_n al desarrollo y en los problemas sociales tanto en Espaí±a -- Europa, como en paí_ses en ví_as de desarrollo. El programa consta de cinco mí_dulos formativos, el desarrollo de un trabajo de campo y la presentacií_n de resultados en un seminario internacional Todos los mí_dulos se estructuran siguiendo un mismo esquema, y contaríçn con un coordinador especializado en la materia. Los mí_dulos tendríçn una sesií_n de videoconferencia, que podríç seguirse online y sí_ncrona, sobre la temíçtica central del mí_dulo. Para las sesiones de videoconferencia se contaríç con personas de reconocido prestigio vinculadas a la Red de Cíçtedras UNESCO, con las que se mantiene relacií_n desde la CATEDRA Ciudadaní_a Democríçtica y Libertad Cultural de la Rioja. Al finalizar cada mí_dulo, los estudiantes deberíçn superar una prueba de asimilacií_n de contenidos que seríç sí_ncrona y online. title: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
short_description: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
long_description: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men. The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise íæ contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rí©gionales íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et au dí©veloppement durable dans 13 pays en dí©veloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est axí© sur le renforcement des capacití©s de 225 organisations clí©s du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí© et de l'í©ducation. Plus particuliíÂrement, il vise íæ : amí©liorer l'accíÂs aux services de santí© et d'í©ducaion, aux marchí©s et íæ la participation politique; favoriser l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rí©gionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí©, de l'í©ducation et de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes. Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'í©tude et de coopí©ration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

title: IMPROVEMENT OF EDUCATIVE CONDITIONS OF MUNICIPAL EDUCATIVE INSTITUTIONS OF EL MILAGRO HAMLET
short_description: IMPROVEMENT OF EDUCATIVE CONDITIONS OF MUNICIPAL EDUCATIVE INSTITUTIONS OF EL MILAGRO HAMLET
long_description: El proyecto busca mejorar el entorno educativo cercano (infraestructura, capacitacií_n a docentes, padres y madres de familia) en tres instituciones educativas municipales (IEM): Gotitas de Amor (nivel inicial), San Martí_n de Porres (nivel primario) y Aroldo Reíçtegui (primaria y secundaria). Los resultados esperados y las actuaciones a realizar, son:R1. Mejoradas las condiciones de infraestructura y mobiliario educativo en las 3 IEM indicadas:-Construccií_n y equipamiento de 2 aulas para el nivel primario y otras 4 aulas para el nivel secundario del IEM Aroldo Reíçtegui.-Construccií_n y equipamiento de 3 aulas para el nivel primario y una cancha deportiva del IEM San Martí_n de Porres.-Construccií_n y equipamiento de 1 aulas para el nivel inicial del IEM Gotitas de Amor.R.2. Los docentes de las tres IEM, estíçn mejor cualificados para realizar su labor educativa:-Programa de Capacitacií_n para docentes: Una educacií_n inicial de calidad (40 horas de duracií_n, 70% príçctica). -Programa para docentes Jugando y cuidando el medio ambiente: 80 horas de duracií_n, con sesiones mensuales.-Programa de capacitacií_n en Consejerí_a educativa y tutorí_a: 22 horas de duracií_n, distribuidas en 11 mí_dulos.R.3. Las madres y padres de familia, estíçn míçs involucrados en el desarrollo integral con equidad de gí©nero de los estudiantes:-Diferentes programas y actuaciones de capacitacií_n dirigidos a las madres y padres de los estudiantes de los tres IEM: Programa La familia principio del cambio social, programa En el hogar y en jardí_n los/as nií±os/as aprenden jugando, clases de cocina econí_mica y nutritiva y escuela de padres varones Equidad de gí©nero en la familia y la comunidad.La iniciativa estíç enmarcada en varias propuestas de desarrollo y estudios sociales realizados en la zona (Diagní_stico participativo Necesidades y potencialidades del CPEM, Plan Concertado de Desarrollo Local el Milagro 2008, Plan Urbano de Desarrollo Local); o a nivel nacional (Proyecto Educativo Nacional) o internacional (Objetivo 2, de los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio).La poblacií_n escolar de las tres IEM asciende a 425 estudiantes y a 22 el ní_mero de docentes directamente involucrados en el proyecto. La gestií_n de las actuaciones correríç a cargo de la Comisií_n Coordinadora del Proyecto, encabezada por el Alcalde y conformada ademíçs por los directores de las tres IEM, representantes de las madres/padres de familia y de los/las docentes.Las tres IEM se encuentran bajo gestií_n municipal y desde el aí±o 2003 asume el pago de las/los docentes. La Municipalidad, junto con las comunidades educativas, han asumido diversos compromisos en el cuidado y mantenimiento de las infraestructuras. Al finalizar el proyecto, la Municipalidad asumiríç la recepcií_n de las obras y de los materiales educativos elaborados con cargo al proyecto. El trabajo de Cí_rculo Solidario Perí_ (CSP) se desarrolla en las zonas urbanas marginales (zonas de extrema pobreza) de los distritos de Trujillo metropolitano desde el aí±o 1995 h

title: Voluntary Cooperation Programme / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire
short_description: VOLUNTARY COOPERATION PROGRAMME / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE
long_description: SUCO's three-month VCP program proposal aims to consolidate the achievements of the five-year program that ended on March 31, 2009. Activities in this regard will focus on consolidating the new knowledge and practices that partners have acquired, as well as developing tools to evaluate, systematize, and capitalize on experience. SUCO will mainly focus its efforts on three CIDA priorities: promoting good governance, supporting private-sector development, and promoting environmental sustainability, with a view to partner capacity-building. SUCO will also help Canadians to learn more about, and become more involved in, development and solidarity among peoples. All activities undertaken in countries of intervention will help to reduce poverty and to promote equality between women and men. / La proposition de trois (3) mois du PCV de SUCO est orientí© vers le renforcement des connaissances et des nouvelles pratiques acquises par les partenaires et le dí©veloppement d'outils d'í©valuation, de systí©matisation et de capitalisation des expí©riences. Les efforts de SUCO seront concentrí©s principalement dans trois secteurs prioritaires de l'ACDI: la promotion de la bonne gouvernance, le soutien au dí©veloppement du secteur priví© et la promotion de la viabilití© de l'environnement dans une optique de renforcement des capacití©s des partenaires. Ils contribueront í©galement íæ accroí¬tre l'í©ducation et l'engagement du public canadien en faveur du dí©veloppement et de la solidarití© entre les peuples. Toutes les actions entreprises dans les pays d'intervention contribueront íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et íæ la promotion de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes.

title: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
short_description: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
long_description: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men. The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise íæ contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rí©gionales íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et au dí©veloppement durable dans 13 pays en dí©veloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est axí© sur le renforcement des capacití©s de 225 organisations clí©s du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí© et de l'í©ducation. Plus particuliíÂrement, il vise íæ : amí©liorer l'accíÂs aux services de santí© et d'í©ducaion, aux marchí©s et íæ la participation politique; favoriser l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rí©gionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí©, de l'í©ducation et de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes. Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'í©tude et de coopí©ration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

title: Savings for All
short_description: SAVINGS FOR ALL
long_description: Caja Nuestra Gente is a Rural Savings Bank in Peru with an important number of low income women who are recipients of a conditional cash transfer (called Juntos Program). This institution was reaching rural areas offering loan products for entrepreneurship, mainly targeted to women, but were mobilizing savings from a different population. With MIF support (ProSavings Program) Caja Nuestra Gente will be developing savings products tailored to conditional cash transfers recipients needs in order to encourage a shift in behavior from immediate consumption to savings, to increase investment in education, health, emergencies and specially small businesses. In Peru most of the financial institutions offer credit to low income people but there is a lack of savings products for this segment. These new products developed by the project will be used at least by 6.000 low income people living in 19 districts of Peru.

title: Assessment of zoonotic parasitic diseases in wild and domestic animals in local indigenous communities of Peruvian Amazon
short_description: AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH

El hecho de que, en la mayorí_a de ellas, los agentes etiolí_gicos originalmente afectaban a animales, ha reactivado la necesidad de estudiar el estado sanitario animal. Las enfermedades parasitarias son enfermedades subclí_nicas y son completamente desconocidas en la regií_n amazí_nica. Estudios nuestros anteriores en comunidades humanas locales ha puesto en evidencia un nivel de infestacií_n del 96% de la poblacií_n. donor: Global Fund to Fight Aids, Tuberculosis and Malaria (GFATM)
title: Making A Difference: promoting a Wide Ranging Integral Response to Tuberculosis and Peru
short_description: MAKING A DIFFERENCE: PROMOTING A WIDE RANGING INTEGRAL RESPONSE TO TUBERCULOSIS AND PERU
long_description: Although the incidence of new cases has been reduced since 1992, TB remains a significant public health problem in Peru, especially multidrug-resistant TB (MDR-TB). The overall goal of the program supported by this grant is to contribute to universal access to prevention services for the general and highly vulnerable populations, as well as to provide care, treatment and complete support for all those affected by TB, MDR-TB and extensively drug-resistant TB (XDR-TB) with a focus on social inclusion and human development. The program targets children, adolescents and young people; university students; indigenous populations; and MDR-TB and XDR-TB patients and their families. Grant funds are being used to improve the bio-safety of the health centers; improve the impact of TB treatment in vulnerable and indigenous populations through a research study and training of health personnel; strengthen advocacy activities in the priority regions and provide nutritional and housing support to XDR-TB patients. This grant is being implemented simultaneously with grants from Round 5 and Round 8.

title: Improving Basic Education for Indigenous and Rural Children in Southern Andean and Amazonian Peru / Amí©liorer l'í©ducation de base aux enfants autochtones et ruraux - Sud des Andes et Amazonie, Pí©rou
short_description: EDUCATION POLICY & ADMIN. MANAGEMENT
long_description: The project aims to improve quality education for indigenous and rural children, especially girls, in Southern Andean and Amazonian Peru through Intercultural Bilingual Education. CIDA's support enables UNICEF to expand its education program in Ayacucho, Amazonas, Apurí_mac, Cusco and Ucayali, regions characterized by extremely high poverty levels, indigenous populations, high prevalence of chronic malnutrition among children and overall lack of quality basic services, including health, education, water and sanitation. The project supports quality learning materials, training of teachers, school directors and education administrators, and strengthening the participation of parents and community members in the education system. The project aims to improve learning strategies, to develop models for replication in other regions and municipalities, and to contribute to the consolidation of regional government capacity to support a regional system of teacher training and to access national financial and technical resources. / Le projet a pour but d'amí©liorer la qualití© de l'í©ducation prodiguí©e aux enfants autochtones et íæ ceux habitant les rí©gions rurales, particuliíÂrement les filles, au sud des Andes pí©ruviennes ainsi que dans l'Amazonie pí©ruvienne, par le biais du programme í_ducation bilingue interculturelle. L'appui de l'ACDI permet íæ l'UNICEF d'í©largir le programme dans les rí©gions suivantes : Ayacucho, Amazonas, Apurí_mac, Cusco et Ucayali. Ces derniíÂres sont caractí©risí©es par des taux extríÈmement í©leví©s de pauvretí©, la prí©sence de populations autochtones, une prí©valence í©leví©e de malnutrition chronique chez les enfants, et le manque gí©ní©ralisí© de services essentiels de qualití©, y compris les soins de santí©, l'í©ducation, l'eau et l'assainissement. Ce projet est axí© sur la production de manuels scolaires de qualití©; la formation d'enseignants, de directeurs d'í©cole et d'administrateurs dans le domaine de l'í©ducation; et le renforcement de la participation des parents et des membres de la collectivití© dans le systíÂme de l'í©ducation. title: Economic Sustainability, Gender Equality and Human Rights / Viabilití© í©conomique, í©galití© des sexes et droits de la personne
short_description: TEACHER TRAINING
long_description: The main purpose of the program is to work directly with Latin American partners to improve the lives of men and women by reducing poverty. CoDev's program focuses on gender equality and citizen participation for good governance through economic sustainability by improving labour rights; the quality of public education; and promoting basic human rights. The program also facilitates and promotes exchange of south-south, north-south and south-north experiences. Key activities of the program include: (1) 625 workshops in the region on education, basic rights and gender issues; (2) 45 community consultations on basic rights; (3) legal accompaniment for 6,000 workers; (4) three regional media campaigns to raise awareness of human and labour rights; (5) 15 rights policy proposals by partners to governments and employers; (6) 30 human rights training programs; and (7) 10 outreach activities in Canada. / L'objectif principal du programme est de collaborer directement avec les partenaires latino-amí©ricains pour travailler íæ l'amí©lioration de la qualití© de vie des hommes et des femmes en rí©duisant la pauvretí©. Le programme de CoDev se concentre sur l'í©galití© des sexes et la participation des citoyens pour une bonne gouvernance par la viabilití© í©conomique en amí©liorant les droits des travailleurs, la qualití© de l'í©ducation publique et en favorisant les droits fondamentaux de la personne. Le programme facilite et favorise í©galement l'í©change d'expí©riences Sud-Sud, Nord-Sud et Sud-Nord. Les activití©s principales du programme comprennent : 1) 625 ateliers dans la rí©gion sur l'í©ducation et les droits fondamentaux en matiíÂre d'í©galití© des sexes; 2) 45 consultations communautaires sur les droits fondamentaux; 3) l'accompagnement lí©gal de 6 000 travailleurs; 4) trois campagnes mí©diatiques rí©gionales pour sensibiliser la population sur les droits de la personne et les droits des travailleurs; 5) 15 propositions de politiques soumises par les partenaires aux gouvernements et aux employeurs; 6) 30 programmes de formation sur les droits de la personne; 7) 10 activití©s de sensibilisation au Canada.

title: APEC Targeted Cooperation Facility
short_description: APEC TARGETED COOPERATION FACILITY
long_description: The APEC Support Program aims to support small, high-impact requests from Australian Government departments and statutory authorities (including universities) for assistance aimed at supporting developing member economy participation in Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC). The program also aims to facilitate and strengthen links between other Australian Government bodies and their developing economy counterparts. Priority for funding under this program will be given to activities which originate from the activities of APEC Working Groups or other APEC entities and which directly assist APEC developing members to implement Bogor commitments on trade and investment liberalisation and facilitation. Priority target countries under the program are Indonesia, the Philippines, China, PNG and Vietnam although other APEC member developing economies and non-APEC higher developing economies and non-APEC high priority Australian aid recipients may also be considered for support. The total value of this initiative is $26.6 million over 10 years, starting 2004-05.

title: Scaling up SABA Saneamiento Bíçsico Integral
short_description: SCALING UP SABA SANEAMIENTO BíÅSICO INTEGRAL
long_description: Country: Peru. Context: Despite impressive economic growth over the last decade, socioeconomic inequalities still prevail in Peru and poverty remains high in the Sierra (60%). In Latin America, Peru shows the highest gap in access to drinking water between poorest and richest quintiles of population. 61% of the rural population in the Sierra lacks adequate sanitation and 39% does not have access to drinking water. Massive investments of the 1990s have proved insufficiently sustainable. Government is committed to reach MDGs by 2015, but sustainable water & sanitation models are still to be implemented. Relevance of intervention: This situation impacts negatively on development and local economy. The relevance of access to good services of water and sanitation for community development is widely recognized. Various impact studies conducted by two SDC funded projects in Peru (in Cusco and Cajamarca) have largely confirmed it. Even remote rural communities develop dynamically, provided they dispose on integral water and sanitation schemes: adequate infrastructures, active participation of water users in a sustainable management and maintenance systems, education and health component. Key results - insights from previous phases: A model for integral water & sanitation in rural areas called SABA has been developed and validated in Cusco and Cajamarca with SDC support. 200äó»000 persons have gained access directly (and 700äó»000 indirectly) to quality water. The SABA model has been institutionalized through regional policies and action plans. Regional governments and municipalities have invested their own funds for implementing the SABA model. National authorities are designing a national policy on the basis of the SABA model. Overall goal: Increase the percentage of population having access to quality water, by contributing to realize a large scaling up of the implementation of the SABA model in the rural municipalities of 7 regions of the Peruvian Sierra (4 in the South and 3 in the North), while capitalizing on the experiences of the SANBASUR and PROPILAS SDC funded projects in Cusco and Cajamarca, respectively. Outcomes of the phase: 1 äóñ The Regional Directorates for Housing, Construction and Sanitation in the 7 regions assume their roles and functions in the sustainable management of water and sanitation; 2 äóñ Local governments (provinces and municipalities) improve the quality of their investment with the replication of the SABA model; 3 äóñ Academic training centres implement consolidated human resources development strategies in the field of integral and sustainable water & sanitation systems, 4 äóñ A Fund is utilized by local governments (provinces and municipalities) to contract specialized professionals and private companies for designing and implementing new SABA projects. Key outputs of the phase: 1 äóñ The DRVCS have been institutionally strengthened; heir capacities have been built up; new management tools have been introduced and are in use; artic

implementing_agency: Fundacií€Œ_n para la Educacií€Œ_n Superior y el Desarrollo
title: Beyond Social Protection: Labour markets, entrepreneurship and gender equality
short_description: BEYOND SOCIAL PROTECTION: LABOUR MARKETS, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND GENDER EQUALITY
long_description: What is the impact of social protection on labour markets and entrepreneurship? Can social protection policies facilitate access to better jobs and business opportunities for the poor? This project will provide policy-relevant evidence to tackle these questions.Traditionally, in most countries in Latin America, access to social security has been linked to employment. Only workers legally registered by their employees and paying dues to the social security administration were eligible for these programs. However, most countries in the region are characterized by high levels of unregistered employment, ranging from 15% in Uruguay to 70% in Bolivia, meaning that most of the population lacks social security benefits. Several countries in the region have started to address the gaps in social insurance coverage by adding non-contributory social protection for those outside the reach of the traditional system. These have resulted in higher levels of protection against risks, and increased welfare. However, concerns around the potential to serve as a pathway to sustainable livelihood are growing. Speculations about potential labour disincentives and a 'culture of dependency' abound, but have not been rigorously examined. This project will examine how non-contributory social protection affects labour supply and entrepreneurship and what complementary policies are needed to enhance the impact of social protection programs. The project proposes to evaluate three social protection programs: - 'UNIDOS' is the main government program for the alleviation of extreme poverty in Colombia and explicitly recognizes that complementary policies are needed for sustainable livelihoods improvement. - 'Pension-65' is a newly created non-contributory pension mechanism in Peru, for eldery 65 or over, in rural districts with high levels of poverty and in a country where pension schemes only cover 5% of the rural elderly. Currently in pilot-stage, Pension-65 will expand geographically in 2012/13. - Asignaciones Familiares - Plan Equidad (AFAM-PE), a non-contributory program created in 2008 in Uruguay, became the main program of income-transfers to low-income households with children. The transfers are conditional on school attendance and health visits.Developing and using state of the art impact evaluation methodologies, combined with qualitative studies, the project will examine and quantify the response of individuals within the household, uncovering gender dynamics. Interaction amongst social protection programs will be analysed using innovative approaches in Peru and Colombia. In the case of Peru, the project will also examine how the program impacts on the local economy, including local markets as well as informal networks of support. The project will enhance research capacity in developing countries and contribute to the advancement of techniques to evaluate the impact of public programs and policies. The relevance of this project extends beyond the three countries.

title: Sustainable and Efficient Management of Peru's Energy Resources / Gestion durable et efficiente des ressources í©nergí©tiques au Pí©rou
short_description: SUSTAINABLE AND EFFICIENT MANAGEMENT OF PERU'S ENERGY RESOURCES / GESTION DURABLE ET EFFICIENTE DES RESSOURCES í_NERGí_TIQUES AU Pí_ROU
long_description: This project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Peruvian Government to plan and manage energy resources efficiently and in a sustainable manner. The initiative is relevant for Peru's economic success, since its recent growth has been fuelled by the development and consumption of its large natural resource base, of which energy resources form an important part. Specifically, the project intends to support the implementation of the Peruvian National Energy Policy which aims to improve energy planning, enhance the use of renewable energy sources and strengthen the capacity of parastatal institutions involved in the sector. Key activities include: technical assistance to the Ministry of Energy and Mines in the design, implementation and staffing of an Energy Planning Unit; the assessment of the corporate governance framework of parastatal institutions; the creation of experts networks to enhance knowledge sharing on renewable energy between public institutions at central and regional levels. / Ce projet vise íæ renforcer les capacití©s du gouvernement pí©ruvien afin qu'il puisse planifier et gí©rer ses ressources í©nergí©tiques de faí_on efficiente et durable. Cette initiative vise íæ contribuer au succíÂs í©conomique du Pí©rou puisque la croissance rí©cente de l'í©conomie pí©ruvienne est grandement attribuable íæ l'exploitation de ses ressources naturelles, incluant ses importantes ressources í©nergí©tiques. De faí_on spí©cifique, le projet supporte la mise en oeuvre de la Stratí©gie í©nergí©tique nationale du Pí©rou qui vise íæ amí©liorer la planification í©nergí©tique, augmenter l'utilisation de sources d'í©nergie renouvelables et renforcer les capacití©s de gestion des organisations parapubliques impliquí©es dans le secteur. Les activití©s principales comprennent : une assistance technique aupríÂs du ministíÂre de l'í_nergie et des Mines afin de concevoir, mettre en place et pourvoir en ressources humaines une Unití© de planification í©nergí©tique; une í©valuation des cadres de gouvernance corporative des organisations parapubliques actives dans le secteur de l'í©nergie; la crí©ation de rí©seaux d'experts afin d'amí©liorer le partage des connaissances au sujet des í©nergies renouvelables entre les institutions publiques au niveau central et rí©gional.

title: Appui institutionnel ? l' Instituto de Medicina Tropical Alexander von Humboldt de Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia - IMT AvH/UPCH dans la recherche clinique appliqu?e pour am?liorer la prise en charge clinique et le contr?le des maladies infectieuses et tropicales
short_description: APPUI INSTITUTIONNEL ? L' INSTITUTO DE MEDICINA TROPICAL ALEXANDER VON HUMBOLDT DE UNIVERSIDAD PERUANA CAYETANO HEREDIA - IMT AVH/UPCH DANS LA RECHER
long_description: Poursuite du projet de collaboration institutionnelle IMT-IMTAvH qui a d?but? en 1998 (FA1, FA2 et FA3-I) in order of impact and level:(1) The leaders, scientists and experts in the partner institutions in developing countries;(2) The health professionals and policy makers that can implement the improved practicesand policies resulting from the programme;(3) The communities and individuals that should benefit from the improved practices and policies To strengthen the rational basis and the country ownership of (human and animal) healthcare systems and policies in developing countries, in order to improve the health status ofthe populations and thereby to contribute to the reduction of poverty and inequity. To strengthen the IMTAvH as a scientifically autonomous centre of excellence in the field of appliedclinical research on infectious and tropical diseases. Special emphasis will be provided to study chemotherapyfailure and/or disease progress in 6 diseases (AIDS, TB, Malaria, Leishmaniasis, HTLV 1related diseases, and bacterial diseases). Res. 1: Institutional management performance engages IMTAvH members to project purposes,strengthens collaboration with ITM and reduces costs and time to achieve specific objectives.Res. 2: Human resources formed under DGDC demonstrate autonomy to conduct sustainableresearch. They are changing agents of clinical and epidemiology management practices.Res. 3: Research laboratories provide the optimal technological platform to host IMTAvH-ITMcollaborative research.Res. 4: Routine laboratories provide specialized analysis derived from proposed and past research,at affordable prices to people with difficult access to health care.Res. 5: Knowledge and education are delivered to health actors in Peru and in other LatinAmerican countries.Res. 6: Bio-medical research produces cost effective tools and knowledge, useful for healthpolicy decision makers.Res. 7: Knowledge and practice are disseminated to national and international actors in policydevelopment through workshop events and guidelines productions for health professionals.

title: Children Lead the Way / Les enfants nous montrent le chemin
short_description: CHILDREN LEAD THE WAY / LES ENFANTS NOUS MONTRENT LE CHEMIN
long_description: The project aims to support girls and boys from infancy to young adulthood become healthy, educated and productive citizens. The project's expected results include improved life opportunities for working youth in Bolivia, Peru, Nicaragua, Burkina Faso and Kenya who are educated about their rights and have acquired marketable skills. It's objectives also include a better quality of primary education for indigenous children in Bolivia through the provision of teacher-training in child-friendly pedagogy, an increased prevalence of exclusive breast-feeding and healthy weaning of newborns and infants in Burkina Faso, the prevention and mitigation of HIV/AIDS as well as improved health of children in Kenya, and the promotion of children's rights in 23 cities across Canada. / Le projet vise íæ appuyer les filles et les garí€Œ_ons, de la premiíÂre enfance íæ l'í¢ge adulte, dans le but de leur permettre de devenir des citoyens instruits, productifs et en bonne santí©. Parmi les rí©sultats escomptí©s du projet se retrouvent de meilleures opportunití©s de vie pour les jeunes travailleurs de Bolivie, du Pí©rou, du Nicaragua, du Burkina Faso et du Kenya, qui ont appris íæ connaitre leurs droits et qui ont acquis des compí©tences reconnues sur le marchí© du travail. Il vise í©galement une meilleure qualití© d'í©ducation primaire pour les enfants autochtones de Bolivie par la prestation d'une formation pour les enseignants en matiíÂre de pí©dagogie adaptí©e aux enfants, une prí©valence accrue de l'allaitement maternel exclusif et le sevrage sain des nourrissons au Burkina Faso, la prí©vention et l'attí©nuation du VIH/sida, ainsi que l'amí©lioration de la santí© des enfants au Kenya et la promotion des droits des enfants dans 23 villes íæ travers le Canada.

title: Prevention of Conflicts Over the Use of Natural Resources / Prí©vention des conflits lií©s íæ l'utilisation des ressources naturelles
short_description: PREVENTION OF CONFLICTS OVER THE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES / PRí_VENTION DES CONFLITS LIí_S íó L'UTILISATION DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES
long_description: Through this CIDA-funded project, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) aims to contribute to a stable economic environment for equitable and sustainable economic growth in Peru by reducing the economic and social impact of conflicts related to the use of natural resources. This project aims to achieve improved prevention and management of resource-based conflicts, and to complement CIDA's efforts in corporate social responsibility and natural resource management. The project provides technical assistance to state agencies, primarily the Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros (similar to Canada's Privy Council Office), regional governments, and other stakeholders on conflict prevention, management, and resolution. / Via cette initiative financí©e par l'ACDI, le Programme des Nations Unies pour le dí©veloppement (PNUD) vise íæ contribuer íæ la crí©ation d'un environnement stable pour le dí©veloppement í©conomique í©quitable et durable du Pí©rou en rí©duisant l'impact socio-í©conomique des conflits lií©s íæ l'utilisation des ressources naturelles. Ce projet contribue íæ l'amí©lioration de la prí©vention et de la gestion des conflits lií©s aux ressources naturelles, et complí©mente les efforts de l'ACDI dans le domaine de la responsabilití© sociale des entreprises et de la gestion des ressources naturelles. ConcríÂtement, le projet offre de l'assistance technique en prí©vention/gestion/rí©solution de conflits íæ certaines institutions publiques pí©ruviennes dont la ''Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros'' (l'í©quivalent pí©ruvien du Bureau du Conseil Priví© du Canada) et les gouvernements rí©gionaux.

title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
short_description: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
long_description: Setting up a network of regional and central governments' institutions acting for conflict management and prevention; and building political concensus for the continuity --beyond the incoming elections-- of the conflict management regional units created in former phases of the project./ Cajamarca (Northern Andes); San Martin (North Western Amazonia); Arequipa and Junin (Southern and Central Andes).This proposal seeks to consolidate the achievements of two successful former projects aiming at building capacities inside the Regional Governments, allowing that conflicts be detected and managed at local level, before they grow critical. There is a growing demand for specialized capacity on the matter, but the number of experts is still short and concentrated in the capital city, while conflicts tend to emerge inside the country and most frequently in the Andean regions.

title: Rural Electrification through Renewable Energy in Isolated Communities in Peru
short_description: RURAL ELECTRIFICATION THROUGH RENEWABLE ENERGY IN ISOLATED COMMUNITIES IN PERU
long_description: This project supports a fee for service model to increase access to clean energy for the poorest families of rural communities in Cajamarca, in the north of Peru. Households can access Solar Home Systems paying a monthly fee that covers leasing of equipment and all after-sales services including maintenance, for the next 20 years. The project is implemented by Peru Micro Energia, PEME, a social micro enterprise. The project also will support institutional strengthening to PEME to assure the sustainability of the organization. A PES operation will provide complementary financing.

title: Promotion and education for health in nine peasant communities of the Nanay river, Loreto
short_description: PROMOTION AND EDUCATION FOR HEALTH IN NINE PEASANT COMMUNITIES OF THE NANAY RIVER, LORETO
long_description: Este proyecto pretende contribuir a disminuir la incidencia de enfermedades prevalentes en 9 comunidades campesinas asentadas en las riberas del rí_o Nanay, regií_n Loreto. Esto se conseguiríç a traves de la promocií_n de híçbitos saludables para la prevencií_n, tratamiento y control de cichas enfermedades entre la poblacií_n.El proyecto beneficiaríç directamente a 3.098 habitantes distribuidos en620 familias, quieren carecer de los servicios de agua y saneamiento apropiados. Estas poblaciones se ven afectadas por enfermedades diarreicas (EDAS), gastrointestinales e infecciones respiratorias agudas (IRAS), todas ellas ligadas a inadecuadas príçcticas saneo ambientales; y ETS ( enfermedades de transmisií_n sexuak) como el VIH/SIDALos resultados esperados del proyecto son:a) Familia y comunidades organizadas sensibilizadas sobre la responsabilidad de cuidar su salud y desarrollar príçcticas saludablesb) Botiquines y agentes comunitarios de salud (ACS) apoyados por los comí_tes de salud vecinales y reconocidos plenamente por el sistema de salud pí_blicac) Agentes comunitarios promotoras domiciliadas de salud capacitadas para promover en comunidades la prevencií_n y atencií_n en salud primariaLas acciones priorizadas estíçn orientadas a fortalecerel funcionamiento de 6 botiquies comunitarios de salud 3 postas de salud. Para ello se propone indicir ante las autoridades para incorporar los ACS y los botiquies comunitarios a la red del sistema de salud pí_blica, de forma que en la reposicií_n de los stock de medicinas para los botiquies.Asimismo, se considera el fortalecimiento de capacidades y desarrollode habilidades atres niveles: a) Capacidades dirijidas a la poblacií_n en general sobre prevencií_n y control de enfermedades y saeamientoanbiental: b) Capacitacií_n a los ACS sobre educacií_n para la salud, atencií_n bíçsica de salud y gestií_n de botiquines; c) formacií_n de promotoras domiciliadas de salud en educacií_n para la salud y saneamiento ambiental, de forma que puedan desarrollar competencias para reforzar las príçcticas saludables a nivel de las unidades familiares.Se incidiríç en la promocií_n de una cultura de prevwncií_n a nivel de toda la poblacií_n y para ello se utilizaríç diferentes estrategias y medios ( charlas, cuí±as, radiales, campaí±a de salud, visitas domiciliarias). Para mejorar la calidad de los servicios de botiquines se construiríçn en ellos 6 letrinas aboneras secas y se instalaríçn 6 sistemas de agua tratadas. Sistema que se promocionaran en la poblacií_n para su adopcií_n futura.

title: MEDA Techno-links: Technology Links for Improved Access and Incomes / MEDA Liens technos : liens technologiques pour amí©liorer l'accíÂs et les revenus
short_description: MEDA TECHNO-LINKS: TECHNOLOGY LINKS FOR IMPROVED ACCESS AND INCOMES / MEDA LIENS TECHNOS : LIENS TECHNOLOGIQUES POUR AMí_LIORER L'ACCí_S ET LES REVENUS
long_description: The Mennonite Economic Development Associates of Canada (MEDA) help local businesses develop financial and agricultural technology-related products and services, so they can better respond to the needs of smallholder farmers and enterprises in Zambia, Nicaragua and Peru. The program has two components: (1) Technology Links for Financial Services: MEDA works with MiCredito, as microfinance institution in Nicaragua and Mobile Transaction Zambia Limited (MTZL) a mobile transaction company in Zambia, to develop their capacity to serve low-income customers with appropriate and affordable financial products; and (2) Technology Links for Agriculture: MEDA establishes an Agriculture Technology Matching Grant Fund in Peru and Nicaragua. The Inter American Development Bank provides grants funding in order to incent private sector investments in agricultural technologies that address the needs of small farmers. CIDA's contribution is used to support technical assistance related to the management and administration of the Fund. / Le Mennonite Economic Development Associates du Canada (MEDA) aide les entreprises locales íæ dí©velopper des produits et services technologiques en matiíÂre de finance et d'agriculture afin de leur permettre de mieux rí©pondre aux besoins des petits agriculteurs et des petites entreprises en Zambie, au Nicaragua et au Pí©rou. Le programme comprend deux í©lí©ments : 1) Liens technologiques pour les services financiers : MEDA travaille avec MiCredito, une institution de microfinance au Nicaragua, et Mobile Transaction Zambia Limited (MTZL), une compagnie d'opí©ration financiíÂre mobile en Zambie, dans le but de dí©velopper leurs capacití©s íæ desservir des clients íæ faible revenu avec des produits financiers adaptí©s et abordables; 2) Liens technologiques pour l'agriculture : MEDA soutient un Fonds de subvention de contrepartie pour les technologies agricoles au Pí©rou et au Nicaragua. La Banque Interamí©ricaine de Dí©veloppement fournit le financement ní©cessaire pour encourager le secteur priví© íæ investir dans les technologies agricoles qui rí©pondent aux besoins des petits agriculteurs. La contribution de l'ACDI permet de soutenir l'aide technique lií©e íæ la gestion et íæ l'administration du Fonds.

title: Oxfam Quebec Voluntary Cooperation Program 2009 / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec
short_description: OXFAM QUEBEC VOLUNTARY COOPERATION PROGRAM 2009 / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE 2009 D'OXFAM-QUí_BEC
long_description: This three-month program will bridge the current program (VCP 2004-2009) and the ''Mieux agir, Mieux influencer'' [more effective action, greater impact] program (VCP 2009-2014). The program is designed to provide an ideal forum to implement activities in preparation for a larger program, and to consider new planning and performance measurement frameworks for the Volunteer Cooperation Program. Through the Volunteer Cooperation Program, Oxfam-Quí©bec aims to help communities in developing countries to initiate or consolidate processes of endogenous development to address major problems relating to poverty and injustice. On the one hand, the program will aim to achieve measurable and tangible results (changes) in the lives of people and organizations (Mieux agir). On the other hand, the program will enable NGOs to build their capacities for dialogue and cooperation with other stakeholders. This will involve making data available during the next program, so that NGOs can become more influential, based on accurate information about the needs of communities, and thus increase the potential impact of public policy (Mieux influencer). In this regard, priority will be given to carrying out studies to provide more effective support for the engagement of partners in specific sectors. During the period, Oxfam-Quí©bec will maintain and continue to strengthen its engagement in five areas of intervention, whose objectives for change focus on basic human rights. These areas are: Economic justice: women entrepreneurs, agricultural development (especially food security), and the private sector - Essential services: access to basic education, access to water and sanitation, improvement of health - Rights in crisis: rights of communities that are victims of humanitarian crises - Gender justice: violence against women and women's rights - Empowerment of youth (crosscutting theme) / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire 2009 d'Oxfam-Quí©bec Le programme de coopí©ration volontaire de trois (3) mois d'Oxfam-Quí©bec vise íæ renforcer son intervention dans cinq secteurs d'intervention dont les objectifs de changement s'articulent autour des droits fondamentaux de la personne. Ces secteurs sont: la justice í©conomique et plus particuliíÂrement l'entrepreneuriat fí©minin, le dí©veloppement agricole (la sí©curití© alimentaire et le secteur priví©); les services essentiels de base, tel que l'accíÂs íæ l'í©ducation de base, l'accíÂs íæ l'eau et íæ l'assainissement, l'amí©lioration de la santí©; les droits en situation de crise, tel que le droit des populations victimes de crise humanitaire; ainsi que l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes, plus particuliíÂrement la violence faite aux femmes et les droits des femmes

long_description: This project enables the participation of representatives from eligible countries at the conference ''Rethinking Extractive Industry: Regulation, Dispossession, and Emerging Claims'' in Toronto, Ontario, from March 5 to 7, 2009. The conference responds to growing public debate and academic interest in the increasing numbers of social, political, and environmental issues and conflicts that are being generated by the recent rapid growth of mining and petroleum industries in Canada, the Americas, and Africa. / Ce projet permet aux reprí©sentants des pays admissibles de participer íæ la confí©rence intitulí©e Œ‚ Rethinking Extractive Industry: Regulation, Dispossession, and Emerging Claims Œé, tenue íæ Toronto (Ontario), du 5 au 7 mars 2009. La confí©rence faire í©cho íæ la hausse des dí©bats publics et de l'intí©ríÈt des universitaires concernant la multiplication des enjeux et des conflits sociaux, politiques et environnementaux engendrí©s par la croissance rapide des industries miniíÂres et pí©troliíÂres au Canada, dans les Amí©riques et en Afrique.

title: UNITERRA Cooperation Programme - (Consortium EUMC/CECI)-2009 / Programme de coopí©ration volontaire UNITERRA (Consortium EUMC/CECI)- 2009
short_description: UNITERRA COOPERATION PROGRAMME - (CONSORTIUM EUMC/CECI)-2009 / PROGRAMME DE COOPí_RATION VOLONTAIRE UNITERRA (CONSORTIUM EUMC/CECI)- 2009
long_description: The program aims to create partnerships between Canadian and developing-country organizations committed to local development. Through volunteer sending, Uniterra helps to mobilize local communities around development policies. Uniterra sends volunteers to 14 countries: Botswana, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Guinea, Malawi, Mali, Niger, Senegal, Bolivia, Guatemala, Peru, Nepal, Sri Lanka, and Vietnam. In each country, Uniterra strategically targets two of the following key sectors: agriculture and rural development, basic education, health and nutrition, HIV/AIDS, youth programs, and private-sector development. This transition phase aims to implement the strategy for the April-June 2009 transition between the current Uniterra program and the 2009-2014 program scheduled to start up in July 2009. The objectives for this period are: Continue efforts to build the capacities of partners in the countries and sectors planned for the 2009-2014 period. Begin to focus programming on fewer sectors and start up activities in new sectors. Implement targeted public engagement activities. Systematize lessons learned and best practices. Begin to update strategies. Plan the reorganization of teams in Canada and in the field to implement the 2009-2014 program (subject to CIDA approval). / Le programme vise íæ crí©er des partenariats entre des organisations engagí©es dans le dí©veloppement local, au Canada et dans les pays du Sud. Par l'envoi de volontaires, UNITERRA soutient la mobilisation des populations locales aux orientations du dí©veloppement. Des volontaires seront envoyí©s dans quatorze pays : Botswana, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Guiní©e, Malawi, Mali, Niger, Sí©ní©gal, Bolivie, Guatemala, Pí©rou, Ní©pal, Sri Lanka et Vietnam. Uniterra vise stratí©giquement deux secteurs clí©s dans chaque pays parmi ceux-ci : l'agriculture et le dí©veloppement rural; l'í©ducation de base; la santí© et la nutrition; le VIH/sida; les programmes pour les jeunes; le dí©veloppement du secteur priví©. Ce programme vise les objectifs suivants: renforcer les capacití©s des partenaires dans les pays et les secteurs identifií©s au programme; initier la concentration de la programmation en identifiant les secteurs les plus prioritaires; rí©aliser des activití©s ciblí©es d'engagement du public; mettre íæ profit les leí_ons apprises et pratiques exemplaires en actualisant les stratí©gies venant appuyer la programmationet notamment en procí©dant íæ la rí©organisation des í©quipes au Canada et sur le terrain.

title: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
short_description: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
long_description: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men. The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise íæ contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rí©gionales íæ la rí©duction de la pauvretí© et au dí©veloppement durable dans 13 pays en dí©veloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est axí© sur le renforcement des capacití©s de 225 organisations clí©s du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí© et de l'í©ducation. Plus particuliíÂrement, il vise íæ : amí©liorer l'accíÂs aux services de santí© et d'í©ducaion, aux marchí©s et íæ la participation politique; favoriser l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rí©gionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priví©, de la gouvernance, de la santí©, de l'í©ducation et de l'í©galití© entre les femmes et les hommes. Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'í©tude et de coopí©ration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

title: CUSO-VSO Program Support April-June 2009 / CUSO-VSO Appui au programme avril-juin 2009
short_description: CUSO-VSO PROGRAM SUPPORT APRIL-JUNE 2009 / CUSO-VSO APPUI AU PROGRAMME AVRIL-JUIN 2009
long_description: CUSO-VSO Program Support April-June 2009 This six-month agreement is a continuation of support to CUSO-VSO that will enable it to make a transition from its current program (2004-2009), to a new 5-year program that is currently under consideration by Treasury Board for approval in Summer/Fall 2009. Under this transition agreement, CUSO-VSO will place 55 volunteers globally as part of existing and new partnerships in five thematic areas: Education, HIV/AIDS, Participation and Governance/Access to Justice for Women & Children, Youth Social and Economic Inclusion, Environmental Protection, with Gender Equality as a cross-cutting theme. Volunteers will be placed in 7 countries in Africa (Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Ghana, Nigeria, Rwanda, Tanzania), 7 countries in Latin America & Caribbean (Bolivia, El Salvador, Guatemala, Guyana, Honduras, Jamaica, Peru), and 1 in Asia (Indonesia). Volunteers can be North-South (Canadian citizens or landed immigrants placed in the South); South-South (Southerners volunteering in other Southern countries; National (Southerners volunteering in their own country); Diaspora (members of Diaspora groups in the North placed in their origin countries); South-North (Southern volunteers placed in Canada). The program's Public Engagement component will increase Canadian public understanding of international development issues and the value of volunteer cooperation; contribute to increased dialogue about international development and Canada's contribution; and engage various Canadian organizations in collaborations with Southern counterparts. / íó venir

long_description: El proyecto: äóìFortaleciendo la Respuesta de los Gobiernos Locales a la Demanda del Tejido Empresarial en la Regií_n Cuscoäóù estíç alineado a los objetivos del PACODE. En el Perí_, es concordante con las polí_ticas del Acuerdo Nacional y del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo de Capacidades, que pretende äóìContribuir a la implementacií_n de polí_ticas pí_blicas de generacií_n de empleo, con enfoque de gobernabilidad en la promocií_n del desarrolloeconí_mico localäóù. El propí_sito busca äóìPromover la efectividad en la respuesta de los Gobiernos Locales a las demandas de los sectores econí_micos estratí©gicos de la regií_n Cuscoäóù. Para lograr estos objetivos plantea cuatro resultados: R1. Se han mejorado las competencias de autoridades y funcionarios pí_blicos municipales de la regií_n Cusco en la gestií_n del desarrollo econí_mico territorial con enfoque de gobernabilidad, R2. Se ha generado unsistema de intercambio de experiencias municipales de promocií_n econí_mica a nivel regional entre servidoresmunicipales egresados de programas de formacií_n en proyectos anteriores, R3. Municipalidades, empresarioslocales, otras instituciones pí_blicas y entidades privadas de la ciudad del Cusco han implementado estrategiasconcertadas de fortalecimiento del tejido empresarial en los principales subsectores econí_micos, R4. Se hatransferido informacií_n a actores del desarrollo econí_mico sobre actividades econí_micas que son la base productivade la ciudad del Cusco.En resumen la estrategia de intervencií_n del proyecto para lograr el propí_sito pasa por: la formacií_n de autoridades ytí©cnicos municipales, la generacií_n de una red intercambio de experiencias, promover el acercamiento entre losgobiernos locales, conductores de pequeí±as y microempresas y otros actores locales; y generar informacií_n para latoma de decisiones de los actores sociales.Los beneficiarios directos son 1.577 personas (623 mujeres y 954 varones), y los indirectos alcanzan a 1.872 (741mujeres y 1.131 varones), representado por autoridades, funcionarios y tí©cnicos de municipalidades, conductores depequeí±os negocios y actores pí_blicos-privados, con quienes se estableceríçn acuerdos de colaboracií_n para lapuesta en marcha y participacií_n en el proyecto.

title: Empowered working women in popular trade strengthen their organizations and improve their income in metropolitan Lima
short_description: EMPOWERED WORKING WOMEN IN POPULAR TRADE STRENGTHEN THEIR ORGANIZATIONS AND IMPROVE THEIR INCOME IN METROPOLITAN LIMA
long_description: El proyecto busca el fortalecimiento administrativo y mejora de las condiciones en las cuales trabajan las autoempleadas y microempresarias del Comercio Popular, actividad que sirve de sustento econí_mico para estas mujeres y sus familias, y que alberga una mayoritaria poblacií_n femenina (70%). La poblacií_n involucrada realiza sus actividades en condiciones precarias de trbajo, no tiene acceso a mecanismos de proteccií_n social (sistemas de seguridad social y pensiones) y actí_a en condiciones de desventaja por la ausencia de un marco jurí_dico adecuado que norme su actividad. A esto podemos aí±adir la poca presencia femenina en su representacií_n gremial, contraria a la composicií_n de su poblacií_n.para lograr cambiar este panorama, el proyecto plantea actuar en 4 componentes: Autoempleados y microempresarios del Comercio popular dessarrollan estrategias comerciales colectivas que permitan mejorar la gestií_n empresarial de sus unidades corporativas y sus unidades individuales. Institucionalizar el enfoque de gí©nero en las Organizaciones del Comercio Popular, integrando mecanismos que faciliten el acceso de la mujer a las instancias de poder y de toma de decisií_n, mejorando su participacií_n digerencial. Fortalecer la gestií_n organizativa, la democracia interna y la actorí_a polí_tica de las Organizaciones del sector de la Micro y Pequeí±a Empresa - MYPE y del Comercio Popular, que incluya un rol activo de las mujeres dirigentes. Promocií_n de polí_ticas pí_blicas con enfoque de gí©nero, dirigidas a mejorar la competitividad del Comercio Popular, permitiendo su formalizacií_n, el acceso a financiamiento, y acceso a mecanismos de proteccií_n social, en su modalidad de autoempleo o de microempresa.

title: Intensification of Smallholder Agriculture in the Andes (CIFSRF)
short_description: INTENSIFICATION OF SMALLHOLDER AGRICULTURE IN THE ANDES (CIFSRF)
long_description: Poverty in rural areas of Peru is almost three times higher than in urban areas, and in certain regions of the Andes, it affects up to 80% of the population. Organic agriculture provides an opportunity to increase overall farm performance, build resilient farming systems, reduce poverty and improve food security in a sustainable way. However, organic farming can do little to improve food security and livelihoods unless ecological, social and economic factors are taken into consideration.This project - supported by the Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF), a joint program of IDRC and the Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) - will enable researchers to examine intensive organic smallholder farming systems in two regions of the Peruvian Andes known for their biodiversity and active farmers' associations.Researchers will endeavor to increase farm productivity, by enhancing ecological cycles, improving seed through participatory plant breeding and valorizing indigenous crops. They will also look at social processes such as traditional knowledge, innovation, organizational links, policy and advocacy. Finally the project will include an economic component, dealing with livelihood dynamics, guarantee systems and access to markets for organic produce in the region.

title: Programme de Coop?ration Universitaire Institutionnelle (CUI) mis en oeuvre par le Conseil interuniversitaire flamand (Vlaamse Interuniversitaire Raad -VLIR) avec la Universidad Agraria Nacional La Molina (UNALM) au P?rou
short_description: PROGRAMME DE COOP?RATION UNIVERSITAIRE INSTITUTIONNELLE (CUI) MIS EN OEUVRE PAR LE CONSEIL INTERUNIVERSITAIRE FLAMAND (VLAAMSE INTERUNIVERSITAIRE RAA
long_description: Long-term collaboration between the Flemish universities and UNALM focused on institutional development and reinforcement of teaching and research at UNALM in order to empower UNALM to better fulfil its role as development actor in society The IUC partnership with UNALM started on 1 April 2010, after having successfully terminated the pre-partnerprogramme started on 1 October 2008.The partner programme is made of seven multidisciplinary projects gathered around the central theme of ''Sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural development'' :Cluster 1: Research on sustainable management of agro-ecosystemsProject 1: Farming systems research (5 subprojects)Project 2: Development of value chains for biodiversity conservation and improvement of rural livelihoods (3 subprojects + 1 transversal)Project 3: Agrarian innovation and management of participatory knowledge systems (1 subproject linked to subprojects in P1 and P2)Cluster 2: EducationProject 4: Educational innovation in undergraduate and graduate programs with emphasis on the sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural developmentCluster 3: Institutional capacity building and infrastructure development Project 5: Capacity building and infrastructure development of TICS, Library and Language CenterProject 6: Capacity building and infrastructure development of Regional Development Centers (IRDs)Project 7: Institutional change and logistic project supportThe core values of the dominant philosophy of the UNALM's Strategic Plan have been guiding the identification and formulation of this program. These values are: sustainable system, natural resources, food, human interaction and social justice, excellence and flexibility and responsiveness. The UNALM is the official state Agricultural University of Peru; as such it is the only specialized academic institution in Peru that provides higher-level education in disciplines related to Agrarian, Forest, Environmental Engineering, Natural Resource Economics, Food Sciences and Rural Development at the national level. Groupes cible: - Academic staff and students of UNALM, - Farming communities and institutions, - Local municipalities Developmental Overall Objective :Improving the food security, the local income, the stability and competitiveness of the agro-ecosystems and thus the overall livelihood situation of the local population through identification and remediation of key agronomic, socio-economic and environmental constraints of small scale family based agriculture in Peru.Academic Overall Objective :Develop, increase, consolidate and internationalize UNALM's academic capacity in research, education, knowledge-transfer and technological innovation in sustainable management of agro-ecosystems to generate leadership in the Peruvian rural sector by maximizing the institutional impact. long_description: El proyecto contribuiríç a que las mujeres de Lima y Huancavelica, ví_ctimas de violencia de gí©nero, accedan a servicios de atencií_n, así_ como a justicia y reparacií_n desde un enfoque de derechos humanos, intercultural y de gí©nero, conectando la violencia ocurrida durante el conflicto armado y la dictadura vivida en el paí_s con la violencia que se da en tiempos de paz y democracia. Para ello se haríç incidencia para que el Congreso y los gobiernos regionales y locales adapten las normas a los estíçndares internacionales de derechos humanos, y cumplan con la polí_tica nacional contra la violencia hacia la mujer y la de reparaciones. Se haríç una campaí±a permanente que involucre el trabajo con medios de comunicacií_n y lí_deres de opinií_n. La actuacií_n beneficiaríç a 332 mujeres y 121 hombres repartidos en operadoros de salud y justicia, autoridades nacionales, provinciales y locales, periodistas y mujeres miembros de organizaciones y afectadas por la violencia de gí©nero.

Por í_ltimo se busca la posibilidad de ofrecer ocio saludable con la príçctica del deporte que mejore la autoestima y fortalezca los logros alcanzados.
